your O
existing O
installation O

OFF O

BACKGROUND O
The O
GOnicus O
System O
Administrator O
is O
a O

based O
administration O
tool O
for O

in O

. O

This O
also O
opens O
the O
door O
to O
privilege O

attacks O
. O

Project O
homepage O
: O
II O
. O

Attacker O

Workaround O

is O
to O
enable O
apache O
.htaccess O
authentication O
in O
all O

containing O

files O
, O
which O
are O
included O

not O

. O

DESCRIPTION O
A O
remote O
attacker O
can O
inject O
into O
GOsa O
arbitrary O
PHP O
code O
that O
executes O
under O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
underlying O
web O
server O
. O

The O
following O
is O
a O
sample O
attack O
URL O
that O
would O
cause O
target.server O
to O
load O
include/common.inc O
from O
attackers.server O
. O

ANALYSIS O
Remote O
exploitation O
allows O
an O
attacker O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
commands O
and O
code O
under O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
web O
server O
. O

There O
are O
serveral O
places O
, O
where O
by O
modifying O
several O
variables O
attacker O
could O
execute O
arbitrary O
PHP O
code O
. O

By O
setting O
plugin O
variable O
in O
following O
files O
attacker O
could O
include O
remote O
files O
and O
execute O
them O
as O
a O
PHP O
code O
: O
plugins/3fax/1blocklists/index.php O
plugins/2administration/6departamentadmin/index.php O
plugins/2administration/5terminals/index.php O
plugins/2administration/4mailinglists/index.php O
plugins/2administration/3departaments/index.php O
plugins/2administration/2groupd/index.php O
The O
same O
situation O
exists O
in O
include/help.php O
where O
we O
could O
set O
base O
variable O
as O
a O
remote O
host O
and O
include O
remote O
file O
. O

Vulnerability O
description O
: O
This O

vulnerable O
to O
Cookie O
manipulation O
attacks O
. O

The O
impact O
of O
this O
vulnerability O
By O
exploiting O
this O
vulnerability O
, O
an O
attacker O
may O
conduct O
a O
session O
fixation O
attack O
. O

In O
a O
session O
fixation O
attack O
, O
the O
attacker O
fixes O

user O
session O
ID O
before O

user O

afterwards O

By O

a O
custom O
jsessionid O
is O
possible O
to O
alter O
the O
session O
cookie O
. O

GET O
/Wiky/index.php/Special/Main/Templates O
cmd=copy O
& O
which= O
< O
meta+http-equiv= O
Set-cookie O
+content= O
userCmd=edit O
How O
to O
fix O
this O
vulnerability O
: O
You O
need O
to O
filter O
the O
output O
in O
order O
to O
prevent O
the O
injection O
of O
custom O
HTTP O
headers O
or O
META O
tags O
. O

Attackers O
will O
normally O
manipulate O
cookie O
values O
to O

authenticate O
themselves O
on O
a O
web O
site O
. O

a O
custom O

header O

by O

a O
META O
tag O

is O
possible O
to O
alter O

cookies O

in O
the O
browser O
. O

affects O
/Wiky/index.php/Main O
. O

variable O

userCmd=edit O
> O

Dada SN
Mail SN
Manager SN
2.6 SV
- O
Remote O
File O
Inclusion O

PHP O
remote O
file O
inclusion O
vulnerability O
in O
index.php O
in O
Joomla SN
1.0.11 SV
through SV
1.0.14 SV
, O
when O
RG_EMULATION O
is O
enabled O
in O
configuration.php O
, O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
PHP O
code O
via O
a O
URL O
in O
the O
mosConfig_absolute_path O
parameter O
. O

In O
Revision O
7424 O
of O
globals.php O
, O
the O
configuration.php O
file O
is O
included O
before O
registerGlobals O
( O
) O
is O
called O
, O
allowing O
a O
malicious O
peer O
to O
override O
any O
value O
set O
in O
configuration.php O
. O

/configuration.php O
require O
( O
dirname O
( O
FILE O
) O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
in O
PHP O
, O
register_globals O
must O
be O
off O
, O
for O
this O
exploit O
to O
work O
. O

In O
older O
Joomla O
versions O
, O
this O
was O
defined O
in O
globals.php O
instead O
. O

The O
exploit O
: O
cript.txt O
Workaround O
: O
In O
index O
.php O
and O
administrator/index O
.php O
change O
: O
require_once O
( O
configuration.php O
) O
; O
to O
require O
( O
configuration.php O
) O
; O
Or O
disable O
RG_EMULATION O
by O
using O
the O
line O
in O
configuration.php-dist O
in O
configuration.php O
: O
if O
( O
! O
defined O
( O
RG_EMULATION O
define O
( O
RG_EMULATION O
, O
0 O
Off O
by O
default O
for O
security O
Regards O
, O
Hendrik-Jan O
Verheij O
BWSS O
B.V O
. O

Affects O
: O
Joomla SN
1.0.13 SV
- SV
1.0.14 SV
Vulnerability O
: O
( O
remote O
) O
PHP O
file O
inclusion O
possible O
if O
old O
configuration.php O
Date O
: O
14-feb-2008 O
Introduction O
: O
Remote O
PHP O
file O
inclusion O
is O
possible O
when O
RG_EMULATION O
is O
not O
defined O
in O
configuration.php O
. O

Details O
: O
Since O
revision O
7424 O
, O
globals.php O
includes O
configuration.php O
if O
RG_EMULATION O
is O
unset O
, O
and O
enables O
RG_EMULATION O
by O
default O
for O
old O
configuration O
files O
: O
if O
( O
defined O
( O
RG_EMULATION O
) O
false O
) O
{ O
if O
( O
file_exists O
( O
dirname O
( O
FILE O
) O
. O

Looking O
in O
index.php O
: O
require O
( O
globals.php O
) O
; O
require_once O
( O
configuration.php O
) O
; O
Since O
configuration.php O
was O
already O
included O
by O
globals.php O
, O
the O
require_once O
( O
) O
won O
t O
include O
the O
configuration.php O
again O
( O
leaving O
attacker O
values O
untouched O
! O
) O
. O

Users O
upgrading O
, O
without O
touching O
configuration.php O
( O
quite O
typical O
) O
, O
will O
have O
RG_EMULATION O
unset O
, O
resulting O
in O
the O
following O
vulnerability O
. O

/configuration.php O
if O
( O
defined O
( O
RG_EMULATION O
) O
false O
The O
configuration O
file O
is O
old O
so O
default O
to O
on O
define O
( O
RG_EMULATION O
, O
1 O
The O
registerGlobals O
function O
is O
called O
after O
having O
included O
configuration.php O
: O
} O
else O
if O
( O
ini_get O
( O
register_globals O
) O
0 O
) O
{ O
php.ini O
has O
register_globals O
= O
off O
and O
emulate O
= O
on O
registerGlobals O
( O
) O
; O
Maliciously O
set O
GET O
variables O
cause O
variables O
set O
by O
configuration.php O
to O
be O
overwritten O
. O

In O
Joomla SN
> SV
=1.0.13 SV
, O
configuration.php-dist O
disables O
register_globals O
emulation O
, O
by O
defining O
RG_EMULATION O
false O
. O

This O
is O
typical O
when O
upgrading O
from O
an O
older O
version O
, O
leaving O
configuration.php O
untouched O
. O

Cisco O

IDs O
: O
CSCvf16705 O
. O

An O

by O

. O

An O

to O

to O

or O

properly O

input O
values O
. O

and SV
7 SV
, O
the O
current O
path O
can O
be O
populated O
with O
an O
external O
URL O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
is O
mitigated O
by O
the O
fact O
that O
you O
must O
have O
enabled O
a O
module O
that O
provides O
an O
XML-RPC O
method O
that O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
brute-forcing O
. O

Depending O
on O
the O
data O
that O
has O
been O
added O
to O
a O
form O
or O
the O
array O
prior O
to O
saving O
, O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
a O
user O
gaining O
all O
roles O
on O
a O
site O
. O

Use O
CVE-2016-3165 O
. O

Brute O
force O
amplification O
attacks O
via O
XML-RPC O
( O
XML-RPC O
server O
- O
Drupal O
6 O
and O
7 O
- O
Moderately O
Critical O
) O
The O
XML-RPC O
system O
allows O
a O
large O
number O
of O
calls O
to O
the O
same O
method O
to O
be O
made O
at O
once O
, O
which O
can O
be O
used O
as O
an O
enabling O
factor O
in O
brute O
force O
attacks O
( O
for O
example O
, O
attempting O
to O
determine O
user O
passwords O
by O
submitting O
a O
large O
number O
of O
password O
variations O
at O
once O
) O
. O

If O
an O
attacker O
carries O
out O
this O
attack O
continuously O
, O
all O
file O
uploads O
to O
a O
site O
could O
be O
blocked O
by O
deleting O
all O
temporary O
files O
before O
they O
can O
be O
saved O
. O

Subject O
: O
Re O
: O
CVE O
requests O
for O

core O
( O

) O

header O
parsing O
code O
in O

0.10.x SV
before SV

, O

through SV

, O

before SV

before SV

, O
and SV
5.x SV
before SV

allows O
remote O

to O
bypass O
an O

protection O
mechanism O
via O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O

handler O
in O
CGit SN
before SV

allows O

attackers O
to O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
Request O
: O
CGit O
- O

vulnerabilities O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
adding O
a O
configuration O
option O
, O

, O
which O
is O
by O
default O
off O
: O
This O
flag O
sets O
anti-sniffing O
, O
CSP O
, O
and O
restricts O
mimetypes O
to O
non- O
application O
( O
except O
for O

and O

) O
and O
non- O
text O
( O
except O
for O

) O
. O

has O
been O

: O

Overflow O
resulting O
in O

Overflow O
[ O

] O

is O

, O
coming O
from O

environment O
variable O
, O
which O
is O
parsed O
by O

. O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
properly O
escaping O
filenames O
in O
headers O
: O
Additionally O
, O
while O
the O
redirect O
for O
the O
/about O
- O
/about O
page O
does O
not O
appear O
to O

vulnerable O

to O

Stored O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
& O
Header O
Injection O
in O
Filename O
Parameter O
[ O
Donenfeld O
] O
A O
user O
who O
has O
write O
access O
to O
the O
git O
repository O
could O
create O
filenames O
containing O
new O
lines O
that O
would O
result O
in O
that O
filename O
, O
including O
the O

being O

in O

, O

in O

injection O
and O
eventually O
XSS O
. O

A O
user O
could O
therefore O
upload O
pages O
with O
malicious O
javascript O
executing O
in O
the O
same O
origin O
as O
the O
cgit O
web O
site O
. O

Reflected O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
& O
Header O
Injection O
in O
Mimetype O
Query O
String O
[ O
Katowicz-Kowalewski O
] O
The O
ui-blob O
handler O
accepted O
a O
mimetype O
as O
a O
query O
string O
and O
then O
echoed O
this O
string O
verbatim O
back O
. O

If O
you O
have O
a O
better O
idea O
of O
what O
sort O
of O
white/black O
list O
to O
use O
for O
this O
, O
I O
am O
open O
to O
suggestions O
. O

By O
storing O
this O
unsigned O
int O
into O
an O

, O
we O

overflow O
it O
, O
resulting O
in O

following O

, O
leading O
to O
a O

overflow O
. O

A O

could O

like O
: O
< O
script O
> O
xss O
< O
/script O

parameter O
: O

then O

: O

, O
just O

header O
as O

: O

. O

, O
Steve O
, O

Package O
: O

vulnerability O
in O
Bugzilla SN
before SV

, O

before SV

and SV

before SV

when O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
load.php O
in O
the O
Local O
Management O
Interface O
( O
LMI O
) O
on O
the O
IBM SN
Proventia SN
Network SN
Mail SN
Security SN
System SN
( O
PNMSS SN
) O
appliance O
with O
firmware O
before SV
2.5 SV
allows O
remote O

users O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
the O
javaVersion O
parameter O
. O

Credits O
Dr. O
Marian O
Ventuneac O

The O
following O
exploit O
allows O
injecting O
custom O
cookies O
used O
by O
the O
client O
browser O
during O
a O

& O

& O

% O
20Inc. O
& O

& O

& O

allows O
forcing O
external O
browser O
redirects O
: O

& O

) O
Mitigation O

Vendor O
: O
IBM O
Products O
: O
Proventia O
Network O
Mail O
Security O
System O
Vulnerabilities O
: O
CRLF O
Injection O
Risk O
: O
Medium O
Attack O
Vector O
: O
From O
Remote O
Authentication O
: O
Required O
Reference O
: O
Description O
Web-based O
Local O
Management O
Interface O
( O
LMI O
) O
of O
IBM SN
Proventia SN
Network SN
Mail SN
Security SN
System SN
( O
firmware O
1.6 SV
) O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
CRLF O
Injection O
vulnerability O
. O

Disclosure O
Timeline O
2009 O
, O
November O
07 O
: O
Vulnerabilities O
discovered O
and O
documented O
2009 O
, O
November O
08 O
: O
Notification O
sent O
to O
IBM O
2009 O
, O
November O
09 O
: O
IBM O
acknowledges O
receiving O
the O
report O
2010 O
, O
September O
12 O
: O
MVSA-10-009 O
advisory O
published O
. O

By O
manipulating O
the O
javaVersion O
parameter O
of O
load.php O
resource O
, O
an O
authenticated O
attacker O
can O
perform O
the O
attacks O
above O
. O

The O
affected O
resource O
is O
not O
part O
of O
the O
IBM O
PNMSS O
firmware O
2.5 O
. O

Vendor O
recommends O
upgrading O
to O
PNMSS O
firmware O
2.5 O
or O
later O
. O

When O
exploited O
by O
an O
authenticated O
attacker O
, O
such O
vulnerability O
could O
lead O
to O
compromising O
the O
security O
of O
the O
appliance O
, O
allowing O
injection O
of O
custom O
HTTP O
cookies O
, O
forcing O
external O
redirects O
, O
potential O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
attacks O
, O
etc O
. O

: O

- O

- O

injection O
vulnerability O
in O
Xerver SN
HTTP SN
Server SN
4.31 SV
and SV

allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O

arbitrary O

and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
certain O
byte O

at O

of O

. O

interface O
in O
CUPS SN
before SV
1.4.2 SV

used O
on O

Abstract O

- O

, O

( O

, O

> O
file O

> O
file O
= O
$ O
this- O
> O

( O
) O
; O
} O
require O
LANGS_PATH O
. O

$ O
this- O
> O
file O
; O
In O

, O

PhpMyAdmin SN
2.7.0-pl2 SV
Path O
Disclosure O
| O
Multiple O
CRLF/Http O
Response O
Splitting O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
viewcvs O
in O
ViewCVS SN
0.9.2 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
CRLF O
sequences O
in O
the O
content-type O
parameter O
. O

Of O
course O
, O
both O
of O
this O
could O
easily O
happen O
on O
web O
sites O
such O
as O
Sourceforge O
( O
who O
, O
however O
, O
introduced O
separate O
subdomains O
for O
user O
authentication O
and O
web O
based O
access O
to O
CVS O
) O
, O
or O
sites O
which O
use O
CVS O
in O
the O
way O
a O
version O
controlled O
wiki O
is O
used O
and O
allow O
public O
write O
access O
. O

However O
, O
all O
of O
the O
above O
requires O
that O
some O
admin O
messes O
around O
with O
CVS O
write O
access O
on O
the O
server O
ViewCVS O
grants O
read O
access O
to O
and O
gave O
access O
to O
someone O
with O
bad O
intentions O
or O
no O
clue O
. O

I O
suggest O
that O
Linux O
distributions O
should O
patch O
this O
issue O
short O
term O
and O
deprecate O
support O
for O
ViewCVS O
mid O
to O
long O
term O
. O

For O
an O
example O
, O
please O
compare O
what O
your O
web O
browser O
displays O
on O
these O
locations O
: O
p/test00.htm O
rev=1.9 O
& O
content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup O
p/test00.htm O
rev=1.9 O
& O
content-type=text/html O
The O
two O
obviously O
look O
somewhat O
differently O
, O
and O
on O
the O
second O
location O
you O
can O
see O
( O
assuming O
you O
have O
Javascript O
activated O
globally O
) O
that O
a O
request O
is O
made O
to O
Google O
( O
from O
within O
the O
security O
context O
of O
cvs.sourceforge.jp O
) O
. O

Short O
version O
for O
the O
busy O
ones O
: O
o O
Security O
issue O
on O
ViewCVS O
0.9.4 O
o O
Not O
really O
exploitable O
unless O
malicious O
users O
have O
CVS O
write O
access O
AND O
victim O
visits O
pre-crafted O
URL O
ViewCVS O
0.9.4 O
is O
no O
longer O
under O
development O
, O
has O
been O
abandoned O
in O
favor O
of O
ViewVC O
( O
and O
should O
probably O
no O
longer O
be O
used O
in O
production O
environments O
. O

Explicitly O
limit O
your O
application O
to O
the O
functionality O
you O
want O
and O
need O
it O
to O
have O
. O

The O
0.9.4 SV
release O
on O
viewvc.tigris.org O
seems O
to O
be O
unpatched O
and O
it O
possible O
that O
some O
Linux O
distributions O
and O
whoever O
would O
normally O
care O
were O
never O
patched O
against O
this O
. O

The O
issue O
is O
one O
which O
can O
hardly O
be O
practially O
exploited O
( O
thus O
this O
short O
and O
boring O
advisory O
and O
no O
prior O
notice O
to O
the O
previous O
developers O
) O
. O

But O
XSS O
is O
just O
one O
possibility O
. O

More O
precisely O
, O
do O
not O
use O
user O
generated O
data O
provided O
in O
HTTP O
requests O
to O
specify O
content O
types O
of O
HTTP O
responses O
unless O
you O
are O
using O
a O
whitelisting O
approach O
. O

Unfortunately O
this O
script O
_is_ O
still O
widely O
used O
, O
so O
I O
think O
it O
still O
worth O
telling O
about O
this O
otherwise O
not O
really O
important O
finding O
. O

This O
means O
that O
ViewCVS O
and O
thus O
the O
domain O
it O
runs O
in O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
, O
assuming O
that O
someone O
not O
fully O
trustable O
has O
write O
permissions O
on O
one O
of O
the O
CVS O
repositories O
ViewCVS O
grants O
access O
to O
here O
. O

The O
source O
of O
the O
problem O
is O
that O
ViewCVS O
allows O
users O
to O
specify O
the O
content O
type O
which O
the O
server O
generated O
HTTP O
response O
will O
be O
sent O
with O
. O

Thanks O
for O
reading O
, O
have O
a O
fine O
day O
. O

However O
, O
it O
is O
actually O
more O
than O
the O
response O
splitting O
issue O
. O

This O
was O
previously O
considered O
a O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
vulnerability O
by O
Jose O
Antonio O
Coret O
( O
Joxean O
Koret O
) O

( O

, O
couldn O

find O
a O
CVE O
, O
AFAICT O
it O
is O
_not_ O
CAN-2004-1062 O
) O
and O
, O
according O
to O
him O
, O
a O
patch O
has O
been O
stored O
on O
the O
1.0-dev O
CVS O
branch O
. O

Web O
application O
developer O
lessons O
learnt O
( O
once O
again O
) O
: O
1 O
. O

This O
should O
also O
work O
for O
delivering O
VML O
exploits O
and O
other O
funny O
stuff O
, O
such O
as O
... O
when O

Details O
: O
It O
is O
important O
to O
note O
that O
due O
to O
the O
nature O
of O
phpSysInfo O
, O
it O
is O
unlikely O
to O
be O
run O
inside O
an O
open_basedir O
, O
since O
most O
of O
the O
information O
the O
software O
obtains O
is O
from O
the O
/proc O
or O
/etc O
directories O
. O

If O
they O
have O
a O
way O
to O
create O
content O
on O
the O
target O
server O
( O
such O
as O
an O
entry O
in O
syslog O
or O
the O
web O
server O
log O
file O
) O
, O
they O
can O
use O
this O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
. O

This O
variable O
is O
fed O
to O
a O
header O
( O
) O
call O
without O
any O
additional O
checks O
. O

We O
have O

, O

BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNATURE O
Version O
: O
GnuPG O
v1.0.6 O
( O
GNU/Linux O
) O

a O
.htaccess O
file O
. O

It O
will O
displays O
things O
like O
Uptime O
, O
CPU O
, O
Memory O
, O
SCSI O
, O
IDE O
, O
PCI O
, O
Ethernet O
, O
Floppy O
, O
and O
Video O
Information O
. O

Using O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
, O
arbitrary O
strings O
can O
be O
injected O
into O
the O
variable O
$ O
charset O
, O
which O
is O
meant O
to O
include O
a O
value O
such O
as O
iso-8859-1 O
or O
similar O
, O
but O
is O
only O
set O
to O
a O
value O
inside O
a O
language O
include O
file O
if O
a O
language O
in O
fact O
requires O
a O
character O
set O
different O
from O
iso-8859-1 O
. O

With O
this O
variable O
, O
arbitrary O
file O
inclusion O
is O
possible O
on O
some O
platforms O
, O
dependant O
on O
the O
local O
realpath O
( O
) O
implementation O
. O

Additionally O
, O
access O
to O
the O
includes O
directory O
should O
be O
restricted O
by O
appropriate O
means O
, O
e.g O
. O

An O
additional O
attack O
vector O
for O
Cross-Site O
Scripting O
attacks O
is O
the O
variable O
$ O
VERSION O
, O
which O
is O
used O
for O
the O
version O
string O
displayed O
on O
the O
bottom O
of O
each O
page O
. O

Credit O
to O
referred O
vulnerabilities O
goes O
to O
the O
original O
authors O
, O
as O
mentioned O
on O
CVE O
. O

Example O
: O
/index.php O
VERSION= O
% O
22 O
% O
3E O
% O
3Cscript O
% O
3Ealert O
( O
xss O
) O
% O
3C/script O
% O
3E O
A O
fairly O
unknown O
attack O
class O
is O
so-called O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
, O
an O
at- O
tack O
that O
allows O
for O
selective O
defacement O
of O
web O
pages O
by O
poisoning O
for- O
warding O
or O
reverse O
proxies O
. O

The O
reason O
for O
this O
problem O
lies O
in O
the O
incorrect O
handling O
of O
variables O
by O
the O
globalization O
layer O
implemented O
in O
phpSysInfo O
index.php O
- O
quote O
: O
if O
( O
! O
empty O
( O
$ O
HTTP_GET_VARS O
) O
) O
while O
( O
list O
( O
$ O
name O
, O
$ O
value O
) O
= O
each O
( O
$ O
HTTP_GET_VARS O
) O
) O
$ O
$ O
name O
= O
$ O
value O
; O
if O
( O
! O
empty O
( O
$ O
HTTP_POST_VARS O
) O
) O
while O
( O
list O
( O
$ O
name O
, O
$ O
value O
) O
= O
each O
( O
$ O
HTTP_POST_VARS O
) O
) O
$ O
$ O
name O
= O
$ O
value O
; O
As O
the O
interested O
reader O
will O
easily O
see O
, O
this O
two-liner O
overwrites O
the O
complete O
scope O
, O
including O
the O
superglobal O
variable O
$ O
_SERVER O
. O

A O
number O
of O
holes O
- O
all O
of O
them O
attributed O
to O
a O
rather O
crude O
( O
and O
unneeded O
) O
register_globals O
emulation O
- O
allow O
for O
arbitrary O
file O
inclusion O
, O
amongst O
other O
things O
. O

Example O
: O
/index.php O
sensor_program=lmsensors.inc.php O
README O
% O
00 O
Additionally O
, O
$ O
sensor_program O
can O
still O
be O
used O
to O
inject O
active O
contents O
into O
the O
page O
, O
known O
as O
Cross-Site O
Scripting O
. O

Direct O
access O
will O
probably O
yield O
an O
empty O
page O
, O
since O
many O
browsers O
do O
not O
know O
how O
to O
handle O
more O
than O
one O
response O
to O
a O
HTTP O
request O
. O

CVE O
Information O
: O
The O
Common O
Vulnerabilities O
and O
Exposures O
project O
( O
cve.mitre.org O
) O
has O
assigned O
the O
name O
CVE-2005-3347 O
to O
the O
file O
inclusion O
issue O
and O
the O
name O
name O
CVE-2005-3348 O
to O
the O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
problem O
. O

: O

[ O

README O
% O
00 O
/index.php O

[ O

README O

lng O
README O
% O

and O
$ O
_REQUEST O
[ O
template O
] O
from O
the O
outside O
. O

: O

Application O
: O

and O
prior O
Severity O
: O

, O

Response O
Splitting O
, O

local O
file O

Risk O
: O
Medium O

In O
fact O
, O
the O
author O
requires O
that O

be O
set O
to O
Off O
and O
no O
other O
restrictions O
be O
imposed O
on O
the O

installation O
. O

A O
hole O
that O
was O
reported O
in O
CVE-2003-0536 O
and O
is O
reported O
as O
fixed O
in O
the O
phpSysInfo O
README O
still O
persists O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
few O
admin- O
istrators O
will O
restrict O
its O
access O
to O

shell O
functions O
, O
since O
a O

unusable O
. O

into O
$ O
_SERVER O
[ O

] O

. O

was O

and O
still O
exists O
. O

A O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
web O
framework O
of O
Cisco O
Small O
Business O
Managed O
Switches O
software O
could O
allow O
an O
unauthenticated O

remote O
attacker O
to O
conduct O
an O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attack O
against O
a O
user O
of O
the O
web O
interface O
of O
an O
affected O
system O
. O

Cisco O
Bug O
IDs O
: O
CSCvg29980 O
. O

A O
successful O
exploit O
could O
allow O
the O
attacker O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
script O
code O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
affected O
web O
interface O
or O
allow O
the O
attacker O
to O
access O
sensitive O

information O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
affects O
the O
following O
Cisco O
Small O
Business O
300 O
and O
500 O
Series O
Managed O
Switches O
: O

Series O

Switches O

Switches O
, O
Cisco O

Stackable O

, O

Series O
Advanced O
Switches O
, O
Cisco O
Small O
Business O
300 O
Series O
Managed O
Switches O
, O
Cisco O
Small O
Business O

Series O
Stackable O
Managed O
Switches O
. O

The O
vulnerability O
is O
due O
to O
insufficient O
input O
validation O
of O
some O
parameters O
that O
are O
passed O
to O
the O
web O

of O

affected O
system O
. O

ntopng SN
before SV
3.0 SV
allows O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
. O

before SV
1.7.15 SV
and O

before SV

, O

to O
lack O
of O

for O
the O

0 O
[ O
ad O
] O
regular O

. O

injection O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
web O
interface O
in O
OpenVPN SN

2.1.4 SV
allows O

to O

to O

for O

, O

allow O

to O

a O

. O

: O

+ O

fixation O

( O

2.1.4 SV
) O
is O

to O

. O

In O

this O

, O

followed O
the O
steps O
below O
: O
1 O
. O

: O

contact O
with O

team O
. O

04/05/2017 O
: O

and O
last O
attempt O
. O

Sent O
a O
malicious O
URL O
to O
the O
victim O
in O
order O
to O
set O
his O
session O
cookie O
. O

( O

) O

Solution O
The O
vendor O
didn O
t O
provided O
a O
patch O
for O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Subject O
: O
[ O
CVE-2017-5868 O
] O
OpenVPN O
Access O
Server O
: O
CRLF O
injection O
with O
Session O
fixation O
OpenVPN O
Access O
Server O
: O
CRLF O
injection O
with O
Session O
fixation O
Description O
OpenVPN O
Access O
Server O
is O
a O
full O
featured O
secure O
network O
tunneling O
VPN O
software O
solution O
that O
integrates O
OpenVPN O
server O
capabilities O
, O
enterprise O
management O
capabilities O
, O
simplified O
OpenVPN O
Connect O
UI O
, O
and O
OpenVPN O
Client O
software O
packages O
that O
accommodate O
Windows O
, O
MAC O
, O
Linux O
, O
Android O
, O
and O
iOS O
environments O
. O

From O
the O
vendor O
side O
, O
several O
steps O
need O
to O
be O
taken O
: O
CRLF O
characters O
must O
be O
escaped O
Session O
cookie O
must O
be O
re-generated O
during O
the O
authentication O
Timeline O
( O
dd/mm/yyyy O
) O
18/01/2017 O
: O
Initial O
discovery O
. O

As O
the O
victim O
, O
access O
the O
OpenVPN-AS O
application O
in O
order O
to O
obtain O
a O
valid O
session O
cookie O
( O
at O
this O
point O
, O
the O
victim O
is O
not O
authenticated O
) O
. O

As O
an O
example O
, O
we O
aim O
to O
inject O
a O
Set-Cookie O
header O
with O
a O
known O
value O
openvpn_sess O
cf23 O
; O
Path=/ O
; O
Secure O
; O
HttpOnly O
`` O
` O
This O
URL O
will O
allow O
the O
attacker O
to O
choose O
the O
value O
of O
the O
session O
cookie O
of O
the O
victim O
. O

At O
this O
point O
, O
the O
victim O
needs O
to O
authenticate O
itself O
. O

Tries O
for O
an O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
attack O

Threat O
Exploiting O
these O
vulnerabilities O
, O
we O
were O
able O
to O
steal O
a O
session O
from O
a O
victim O
and O
then O
access O
the O
application O
( O
OpenVPN-AS O
) O
with O
his O
rights O
. O

CVE O
ID O
: O

L O
CRLF O
injection O
It O
is O
possible O
to O
inject O
a O
CRLF O
character O
like O
` O
% O
0A` O
using O
the O
URL O
GET O
session_start O
/ O
% O
0atest O
HTTP/1.1 O
Host O
: O
User-Agent O
: O
Mozilla/5.0 O
( O
X11 O
; O
Linux O
x86_64 O
; O
rv:45.0 O
) O
Gecko/20100101 O
Firefox/45.0 O
Accept O
: O
text/html O
, O
application/xhtml+xml O
, O
application/xml O
; O
q=0.9 O
, O
; O
q=0.8 O
Accept-Language O
: O
en-US O
, O
en O
; O
q=0.5 O
Connection O
: O
close O
Cookie O
: O
openvpn_sess O
dc61 O
Pragma O
: O
no-cache O
Cache-Control O
: O
no-cache O
`` O
` O
As O
a O
result O
, O
we O
obtained O
this O
response O
from O
the O
server O
HTTP/1.1 O
302 O
Found O

: O

, O
18 O
Jan O
2017 O

: O

/html O
`` O
` O
Thus O
, O
the O
` O
% O
0A` O
character O
is O
taken O
into O
account O
and O
we O
can O
clearly O
see O
the O
test O
string O
at O
an O
unexpected O
location O
. O

We O
have O
not O
been O
able O
to O
exploit O
it O
but O
the O
application O
may O
be O
prone O
to O
HTTP O
Response O

attacks O
. O

Exploiting O
this O
on O
an O
administrator O
account O
may O
lead O
to O
serious O
consequences O
. O

Using O
a O
CRLF O
injection O
in O
order O
to O
do O
a O
session O
fixation O
attack O
Using O
the O
CRLF O
injection O
and O
a O
problem O
during O
the O
authentication O
phase O
( O
the O
session O
cookie O
is O
not O
re-generated O
) O
, O
we O
were O
able O
to O
successfully O
exploit O
a O
session O
fixation O
vulnerability O
. O

Restrict O
access O
to O
the O
web O
interface O
( O
for O
instance O
, O

) O
. O

, O

can O

: O
Use O
a O

in O
order O
to O
restrict O
CRLF O
characters O
in O
URI O
. O

His O

then O

with O
the O
session O
cookie O
controlled O

. O

Using O
the O
character O
% O
0A O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
inject O
headers O
and O
content O
. O

Indeed O
, O
during O
the O
authentication O
the O
session O
cookie O
is O
poorly O
handled O
. O

: O

in O

Network SN
Automation SN

before SV

VMware O

Hypervisor O
is O
based O
on O
VMware O

, O

hypervisor O

that O
sets O

Details O
: O

found O
out O
that O

server O
of O

ESXi O
6 O

. O

( O

) O
: O

PGP O
SIGNATURE O

Due O
to O
improper O
input O
validation O
, O
the O
web O
server O
of O
VMware O
ESXi O
6 O
is O
prone O
to O
HTTP O
response O
injection O
attacks O
. O

E-Mail O
: O
matthias.deeg O
( O
at O
) O
syss.de O
Public O
Key O
: O
g.asc O
Key O
fingerprint O
= O
D1F0 O
A035 O
F06C O
E675 O
CDB9 O
0514 O
D9A4 O
BF6A O
34AD O
4DAB O
Disclaimer O
: O
The O
information O
provided O
in O
this O
security O
advisory O
is O
provided O
as O
is O
and O
without O
warranty O
of O
any O
kind O
. O

Thus O
, O
an O
attacker O
can O
create O
a O
specially O
crafted O
URL O
with O
a O
specific O
URL O
parameter O
that O
injects O
attacker-controlled O
data O
to O
the O
response O
of O
the O
VMware O
ESXi O
web O
server O
. O

Fixed O
Manufacturer O
Notification O
: O
2016-07-01 O
Solution O
Date O
: O
2016-08-04 O
Public O
Disclosure O
: O
2016-08-05 O
CVE O
Reference O
: O
CVE-2016-5331 O
Authors O
of O
Advisory O
: O
Matthias O
Deeg O
( O
SySS O
GmbH O
Overview O
: O
VMware O
vSphere O
Hypervisor O
is O
a O
type-1 O
hypervisor O
for O
serving O
virtual O
machines O
. O

[ O
SYSS-2016-063 O
] O
VMware SN
ESXi SN
6 SV
- O
Improper O
Input O
Validation O
( O
CWE-20 O
) O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
Ecava SN
IntegraXor SN
before SV
5.0 SV
build SV
4522 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
a O
crafted O
URL O
. O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
cgit_print_http_headers O
function O
in O
ui-shared.c O
in O
CGit SN
before SV
0.12 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
with O
permission O
to O
write O
to O
a O
repository O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
or O
cross-site O
scripting O
( O
XSS O
) O
attacks O
via O
newline O
characters O
in O
a O
filename O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
Request O
: O
CGit O
- O
Multiple O
vulnerabilities O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
adding O
a O
configuration O
option O
, O
enable-html-serving O
, O
which O
is O
by O
default O
off O
: O
This O
flag O
sets O
anti-sniffing O
, O
CSP O
, O
and O
restricts O
mimetypes O
to O
non- O
application O
( O
except O
for O
application/pdf O
and O
application/octet-stream O
) O
and O
non- O
text O
( O
except O
for O
text/plain O
) O
. O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
this O
commit O
: O
A O
new O
version O
containing O
these O
security O
fixes O
will O
be O
published O
shortly O
. O

Thanks O
, O
Jason O

Hi O
folks O
, O
Krzysztof O
Katowicz-Kowalewski O
from O
ESET O
, O
Erik O
Cabetas O
from O
Include O
Security O
, O
and O
myself O
( O
Jason O
Donenfeld O
) O
from O
Edge O
Security O
, O
have O
found O
a O
few O
vulnerabilities O
in O
CGit O
: O
1 O
. O

While O
this O
is O
ordinarily O
not O
a O
problem O
for O
single-use O
users O
- O
and O
indeed O
some O
users O
rather O
like O
being O
able O
to O
serve O
html O
from O
cgit O
- O
sites O
that O
allow O
potentially O
malicious O
third O
party O
users O
may O
not O
find O
this O
behavior O
desirable O
. O

Integer O
Overflow O
resulting O
in O
Buffer O
Overflow O
[ O
Cabetas O
] O
ctx.env.content_length O
is O
an O
unsigned O
int O
, O
coming O
from O
the O
CONTENT_LENGTH O
environment O
variable O
, O
which O
is O
parsed O
by O
strtoul O
. O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
properly O
escaping O
filenames O
in O
headers O
: O
Additionally O
, O
while O
the O
redirect O
for O
the O
/about O
- O
/about O
page O
does O
not O
appear O
to O
be O
vulnerable O
due O
to O
mitigating O
conditions O
, O
the O
following O
commit O
was O
made O
to O
similarly O
harden O
potential O
injections O
here O
: O
3 O
. O

Stored O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
in O
Git O
Repo O
Files O
[ O
Katowicz-Kowalewski O
] O
A O
user O
who O
has O
write O
access O
to O
the O
git O
repository O
can O
add O
HTML O
pages O
and O
then O
serve O
them O
with O
an O
HTML O
mimetype O
. O

Date O
: O
Thu O
, O
14 O
Jan O
2016 O
15:21:36 O
+0100 O

: O

The O
HTTP/1.1 O
spec O
says O
that O
any O
Content-Length O
greater O
than O
or O
equal O
to O
zero O
is O
a O
valid O
value O
. O

Stored O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
& O
Header O
Injection O
in O
Filename O
Parameter O
[ O
Donenfeld O
] O
A O
user O
who O
has O
write O
access O
to O
the O
git O
repository O
could O
create O
filenames O
containing O
new O
lines O
that O
would O
result O
in O
that O
filename O
, O
including O
the O
newlines O
, O
being O
included O
in O
a O
header O
, O
resulting O
in O
header O
injection O
and O
eventually O
XSS O
. O

A O
user O
could O
therefore O
upload O
pages O
with O
malicious O
javascript O
executing O
in O
the O
same O
origin O
as O
the O
cgit O
web O
site O
. O

Reflected O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
& O
Header O
Injection O
in O
Mimetype O
Query O
String O
[ O
Katowicz-Kowalewski O
] O
The O
ui-blob O
handler O
accepted O
a O
mimetype O
as O
a O
query O
string O
and O
then O
echoed O
this O
string O
verbatim O
back O
. O

If O
you O
have O
a O
better O
idea O
of O
what O
sort O
of O
white/black O
list O
to O
use O
for O
this O
, O
I O
am O
open O
to O
suggestions O
. O

By O
storing O
this O
unsigned O
int O
into O
an O
int O
, O
we O
potentially O
overflow O
it O
, O
resulting O
in O
the O
following O
bounding O
check O
failing O
, O
leading O
to O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
. O

A O
malicious O
user O
could O
provide O
a O
string O
like O
: O
< O
script O
> O
xss O
< O
/script O
This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
removing O
support O
for O
the O
mimetype O
query O
string O
parameter O
: O
And O
then O
restricting O
to O
only O
generic O
mimetypes O
: O
And O
finally O
, O
just O
in O
case O
, O
setting O
the O
IE O
anti-sniffing O
header O
as O
well O
as O
a O
restrictive O
CSP O
header O
: O
2 O
. O

However O
, O
we O
typically O
don O
t O
want O
to O
have O
a O
CVE O
for O
a O
design O
change O
that O
probably O
breaks O
a O
number O
of O
existing O
installations O
unless O
reconfigured O
. O

This O
has O
been O
fixed O
by O
properly O
escaping O
filenames O
in O
headers O
: O
Use O
CVE-2016-1900 O
. O

And O
then O
restricting O
to O
only O
generic O
mimetypes O
: O
And O
finally O
, O
just O
in O
case O
, O
setting O
the O
IE O
anti-sniffing O
header O
as O
well O
as O
a O
restrictive O
CSP O
header O
: O
There O
is O
no O
CVE O
ID O
associated O
with O
either O
of O
these O
other O
changes O
, O
which O
seem O
to O
be O
for O
defense-in-depth O
purposes O
. O

: O
CVE O
Request O
: O
CGit O
- O
Multiple O
vulnerabilities O

CRLF O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
on_req O
function O
in O
lib/handler/redirect.c O
in O
H2O SN
before SV
1.6.2 SV
and SV
1.7.x SV
before SV
1.7.0-beta3 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
a O
crafted O
URI O
. O

Varnish SN
3.x SV
before SV
3.0.7 SV
, O
when O
used O
in O
certain O
stacked O
installations O
, O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
HTTP O
headers O
and O
conduct O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
attacks O
via O
a O
header O
line O
terminated O
by O
a O
( O
carriage O
return O
) O
character O
in O
conjunction O
with O
multiple O
Content-Length O
headers O
in O
an O
HTTP O
request O
. O

Stop O
recognizing O
a O
single O
CR O
( O
r O
) O
as O
a O
HTTP O
line O
separator O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
request O
: O
Varnish SN
3 SV
before SV
3.0.7 SV
was O
vulnerable O
to O
HTTP O
Smuggling O
issues O
: O
Double O
Content O
Length O
and O
bad O
EOL O
Varnish O
4.x O
serie O
is O
not O
impacted O
. O

Changelog O
is O
: O
Requests O
with O
multiple O
Content-Length O
headers O
will O
now O
fail O
. O

This O
opened O
up O
a O
possible O
cache O
poisoning O
attack O
in O
stacked O
installations O
where O
sslterminator/varnish/backend O
had O
different O
CR O
handling O
. O

Combinations O
of O
theses O
two O
flaws O
in O
HTTP O
protocol O
handling O
allows O
for O
HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O
attacks O
when O
another O
actor O
in O
front O
of O
Varnish3 O
can O
transmit O
headers O
in O
this O
form O
( O
for O
example O
) O
: O
Dummy O
: O
header O
Content-Length O
: O
0 O
This O
is O
a O
one O
year O
old O
issue O
, O
on O
the O
old O
last O
release O
of O
this O
serie O
. O

Fixed O
in O
version O
3.0.7 O
in O
march O
2015 O
. O

But O
we O
still O
find O
some O
installations O
. O

A O
CVE O
would O
maybe O
help O
removal O
of O
3.x O
installations O
, O
or O
at O
least O
upgrades O
to O
3.0.7 O
. O

Desc O
: O
Kallithea O
suffers O
from O
a O
HTTP O
header O
injection O
( O
response O
splitting O
) O
vulnerability O
because O
it O
fails O
to O
properly O
sanitize O
user O
input O
before O
using O
it O
as O
an O
HTTP O
header O
value O
via O
the O
GET O
came_from O
parameter O
in O
the O
login O
instance O
. O

This O
type O
of O
attack O
not O
only O
allows O
a O
malicious O
user O
to O
control O
the O
remaining O
headers O
and O
body O
of O
the O
response O
the O
application O
intends O
to O
send O
, O
but O
also O
allow O
them O
to O
create O
additional O
responses O
entirely O
under O
their O
control O
. O

0.2.9 SV
- O

HTTP O
Response O
Splitting O

injection O
vulnerability O

via O
a O

bucket O

. O

vulnerability O
in O

before SV
7.2.2 SV
, O
when O

, O

to O

This O
can O
lead O
to O

or O
triggering O

actions O
via O

interface O
( O
sending O

, O

data O
etc O
. O
) O

While O
the O
most O
commonly O
used O
MIME-types O
are O
covered O
( O
text/html O
) O
, O
some O
browsers O
also O
execute O
script O
code O
within O
files O
signalled O
with O
text/xml O
MIME-type O
. O

: O

user O
may O
be O
tricked O
to O
open O
a O

pointing O
to O
a O
trusted O
URL O
. O

takes O
place O
for O
requests O
where O

MIME O
type O
indicates O
that O

will O
be O

We O
originally O
thought O
that O
there O
was O
interest O
in O
separate O
CVE O
IDs O
for O
the O
header O
function O
is O
unsafe O
when O
a O
URL O
contains O
any O
recognized O
end-of-line O
character O
and O
the O
header O
function O
is O
unsafe O
when O
a O
URL O
contains O
a O
% O
0D O
sequence O
. O

We O
probably O
haven O
t O
found O
the O
exact O
affected O
5.4.0RC SV
versions O
, O
but O
this O
doesn O
t O
matter O
much O
because O
those O
versions O
aren O
t O
widely O
used O
. O

, O
we O
now O
understand O
that O
the O
first O
CVE O
is O
not O
wanted O
at O
all O
, O
which O
seems O
reasonable O
. O

: O

the O
protection O
bypass O
> O

describes O
the O

to O
fully O
fix O

bypass O

The O
sapi_header_op O
function O
in O
main/SAPI.c O
in O
PHP SN
before SV
5.3.11 SV
and SV
5.4.x SV
before SV

does O
not O
check O
for O
% O
0D O
sequences O
( O
aka O
carriage O
return O
characters O
) O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
an O
HTTP O
response-splitting O
protection O
mechanism O

URL O

to O

interaction O
between O

Admittedly O

CVE O
users O
it O
doesn O
t O
matter O
. O

MITRE O
prefers O
to O
categorize O
this O
type O
of O
situation O
as O
an O
incorrect O
fix O
not O
an O
incomplete O
fix O
. O

: O

2.html O
The O
following O
Resolved O
Caveat O

The O
CTU O
frequently O
serves O
as O
an O
expert O
resource O
for O
the O
media O
, O
publishes O
technical O
analyses O
for O
the O
security O
community O
and O
speaks O
about O
emerging O
threats O
at O
security O
conferences O
. O

Details O
When O
a O
user O
connects O
to O
the O
web O
interface O
of O
the O
ASA O
via O

automatically O

the O

. O

emerge O

develop O

of O

for O

in O

TIMELINE O
20071113 O
Bug O
discovered O
20071218 O

Magic O
quotes O
ON O
will O
protect O
you O
against O
the O
most O

unauthenticated O
SQLi O
vulnerabilities O
and O
possibly O
other O

This O
causes O
an O

Injection O
attack O
possible O
. O

This O
produces O

error O
that O
discloses O
the O
absolute O
installation O
path O
: O
Other O
vulnerable O
code O
exists O
since O
in O

they O

After O

of O

input O

create O

( O

[ O

] O
) O
. O

function O

aoutx.h O

( O

libarchive O
component O
. O

It O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
or O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
buffer O
overflow O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
archive O
file O
. O

An O
issue O
was O
discovered O
in O
certain O
Apple O
products O
. O

macOS SN
before SV
10.13.1 SV
is O
affected O
. O

There O
is O
an O
infinite O
loop O
in O
the O
next_char O
function O
in O
comp_scan.c O
in O
ncurses SN
6.0 SV
, O
related O
to O
libtic O
. O

A O
crafted O
input O
will O
lead O
to O
a O
remote O
denial O
of O
service O
attack O
. O

The O
id3_field_parse O
function O
in O
field.c O
in O
libid3tag SN
0.15.1b SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
OOM O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
MP3 O
file O
. O

The O
grant-table O
feature O
in O
Xen SN
through SV
4.8.x SV
mishandles O
MMIO O
region O
grant O
references O
, O
which O
allows O
guest O
OS O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
loss O
of O
grant O
trackability O
) O
, O
aka O
XSA-224 O
bug O
3 O
. O

The O
getvalue O
function O
in O
tekhex.c O
in O
the O
Binary O
File O
Descriptor O
( O
BFD O
) O
library O
( O
aka O
libbfd O
) O
, O
as O
distributed O
in O
GNU SN
Binutils SN
2.28 SV
, O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
stack-based O
buffer O
over-read O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
tekhex O
file O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
mishandling O
within O
the O
nm O
program O
. O

In O
lrzip SN
0.631 SV
, O
a O
stack O
buffer O
overflow O
was O
found O
in O
the O
function O

in O

, O
which O
allows O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
via O
a O
crafted O
file O
. O

The O
score_opcodes O
function O
in O
opcodes/score7-dis.c O
in O
GNU SN
Binutils SN
2.28 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
buffer O
overflow O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
or O

Concept O
: O

LAME O
is O

tool O
to O
be O

about O

. O

LAME SN
3.99.5 SV
- O
Multiple O
Vulnerabilities O

Memory O
leak O
in O
QEMU O
( O
aka O
Quick O
Emulator O
) O
, O
when O
built O
with O
IDE O
AHCI O
Emulation O
support O
, O
allows O
local O
guest O
OS O

users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
consumption O
) O
by O
repeatedly O

the O
AHCI O
device O
. O

Thank O
you O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE-2017-9373 O
Qemu O
: O
ide O
: O
ahci O
host O
memory O
leakage O
during O
hotunplug O
Hello O
, O
Quick O
emulator O
built O
with O
the O
IDE O
AHCI O
Emulation O
support O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
host O
memory O
leakage O
issue O
. O

patch O
: O
- O

: O
- O

issue O
was O
reported O
by O
Li O
Qiang O
of O
Qihoo O
360 O
Gear O
Team O
. O

could O

while O

. O

Analysis O
: O
The O
bug O
is O
in O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
function O
, O
specifically O
in O
this O
part O
: O
for O
( O
auto O
& O
associatedElement O
: O
m_associatedElements O
) O
{ O
if O
( O
is O
< O
HTMLFormControlElement O
> O
( O
associatedElement O
) O
) O
downcast O
< O
HTMLFormControlElement O
> O
( O
associatedElement O
) O
.reset O
( O
) O
; O
} O
The O
issue O
is O
that O
while O
m_associatedElements O
vector O
is O
being O
iterated O
, O
its O
content O
can O
change O
( O
HTMLFormControlElement O
being O
added O
or O
removed O
from O
it O
) O
. O

Using O
this O
trick O
we O
can O
remove O
elements O
from O
m_associatedElements O
while O
it O
is O
being O
iterated O
. O

I O
did O
this O
by O
adding O
DOMSubtreeModified O
event O
listener O
to O
the O
output O
element O
, O
so O
that O
when O
the O
output O
element O
gets O
reset O
, O
the O
event O
triggers O
and O
in O
the O
event O
hanlder O
newly O
created O
input O
elements O
are O
added O
to O
the O
form O
. O

Since O
HTMLFormControlElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
is O
a O
virtual O
function O
, O
this O
can O
easily O
lead O
to O
code O
execution O
. O

The O
loop O
inside O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
continues O
to O
iterate O
over O
now O
deleted O
buffer O
, O
causing O
the O
use-after O
free O
condition O
. O

This O
causes O
the O
vector O
buffer O
to O
be O
reallocated O
to O
accommodate O
the O
new O
form O
elements O
. O

However O
, O
this O
by O
itself O
is O
not O
sufficient O
to O
exploit O
this O
issue O
as O
m_associatedElements.remove O
( O
index O
) O
( O
called O
from O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:removeFormElement O
( O
) O
) O
won O
t O
actually O
reallocate O
the O
vector O
buffer O
, O
it O
will O
only O
decrease O
vector O
m_size O
and O
the O
vector O
elements O
after O
m_size O
will O
still O
point O
to O
the O
( O
former O
) O
form O
members O
. O

Also O
note O
that O
the O
size O
of O
the O
freed O
buffer O
can O
be O
chosen O
by O
the O
attacker O
) O
, O
subsequent O
iterations O
over O
m_associatedElements O
will O
cause O
HTMLFormControlElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
method O
to O
be O
called O
on O
the O
attacker-controlled O
pointer O
. O

Normally O
HTMLFormControlElement.reset O
( O
) O
doesn O
t O
change O
the O
DOM O
, O
but O
there O
is O
one O
exception O
to O
this O
: O
The O
output O
element O
. O

So O
instead O
of O
removing O
elements O
from O
the O
m_associatedElements O
vector O
, O
I O
instead O
add O
elements O
to O
it O
while O
it O
is O
being O
iterated O
. O

( O
It O
might O
be O
possible O
to O
force O
the O
removed O
form O
members O
to O
be O
deleted O
but O
I O
haven O
t O
experimented O
with O
this O
) O
. O

If O
an O
attacker O
manages O
to O
reclaim O
the O
space O
of O
the O
freed O
buffer O
and O
fill O
it O
with O
attacker-controlled O
data O
( O
there O
is O
plenty O
of O
opportunity O
to O
do O
this O
inside O
the O
DOMSubtreeModified O
event O
handler O
. O

Apple O
WebKit O
- O
HTMLFormElement O
: O
:reset O
( O
) O
Use-After O
Free O

versions O
of O
the O
NVIDIA O
Windows O
GPU O

Driver O

mode O
layer O

user O
provided O
input O
used O
as O

size O
is O
not O
correctly O
validated O
allows O
out O
of O
bound O
access O
in O
kernel O
memory O
and O
may O
lead O
to O
denial O
of O
service O
or O
potential O

of O
privileges O

The O
jpc_dec_process_siz O
function O
in O
libjasper/jpc/jpc_dec.c O
in O
JasPer SN
before SV
1.900.4 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
divide-by-zero O
error O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
YRsiz O
value O
in O
a O
BMP O
image O
to O
the O
imginfo O
command O
. O

THAT O
IS O
, O
THE O
JASPER O
SOFTWARE O
CAN O
NOT O
DECODE O
ALL O
TYPES O
OF O
BMP O
DATA O
. O

on O
what O
I O
said O
, O
I O
don O

know O
if O

of O

following O

Hello O
all O
, O
I O
fuzzed O
jasper O
and O
it O
revealed O
some O
crashes O
, O
we O
know O
that O
jasper O
has O
no O
more O
release O
( O
s O
) O
since O
a O
lot O
of O
time O
, O
so O
there O
are O
some O
unfixed O
vulnerabilities O
. O

IF O
YOU O
HAVE O
ANY O
PROBLEMS O
, O
PLEASE O
TRY O
CONVERTING O
YOUR O
IMAGE O
DATA O
TO O
THE O
PNM O
FORMAT O
, O
AND O
USING O
THIS O
FORMAT O
INSTEAD O
. O

Jenkins SN
before SV
2.3 SV
and SV
LTS SV
before SV
1.651.2 SV
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
users O
to O
trigger O
updating O
of O
update O
site O
metadata O
by O
leveraging O
a O
missing O
permissions O
check O
. O

NOTE O
: O
this O
issue O
can O
be O
combined O
with O
DNS O
cache O
poisoning O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
service O
disruption O
) O
. O

A O
remote O
attacker O
could O
exploit O
this O
vulnerability O
to O
read O
arbitrary O
files O
on O
the O
system O
or O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
. O

Multiple O
unspecified O
vulnerabilities O
in O
browser O
engine O
in O
Mozilla SN
Firefox SN
before SV
48.0 SV
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
corruption O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
or O
possibly O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
unknown O
vectors O
. O

Squid SN
3.x SV
before SV
3.5.15 SV
and SV
4.x SV
before SV
4.0.7 SV
does O
not O
properly O
append O
data O
to O
String O
objects O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
servers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
assertion O
failure O
and O
daemon O
exit O
) O
via O
a O
long O
string O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
a O
crafted O
HTTP O
Vary O
header O
. O

It O
is O
not O
easily O
triggered O
in O
Squid-3 O
or O
normally O
in O
Squid-4 O
. O

There O
is O
( O
currently O
) O
no O
CVE O
ID O
for O
the O
remaining O
unsolved O
problem O
associated O
with O
this O
though O
not O
fully O
solve O
statement O
. O

This O
patch O
fixes O
the O
other O
related O
variant O
of O
the O
basic O
problem O
. O

However O
, O
there O
are O
currently O
4 O
known O
distinct O
vectors O
( O
types O
of O
remotely O
provided O
input O
) O
with O
varying O
degrees O
of O
difficulty O
to O
trigger O
the O
assertion O
. O

Error O
handling O
for O
malformed O
HTTP O
responses O
can O
lead O
to O
a O
second O
assertion O
with O
the O
same O
effects O
as O
the O
first O
issue O
. O

Some O
code O
paths O
do O
not O
bounds O
check O
before O
appending O
to O
these O
String O
and O
overflow O
leads O
to O
an O
assertion O
which O
terminates O
all O
client O
transactions O
using O
the O
proxy O
, O
including O
those O
unrelated O
to O
the O
limit O
being O
exceeded O
. O

For O
example O
: O
Vary O
: O
Cookie O
, O
Cookie O
, O
Cookie O
, O
Cookie O
, O
... O

Patch O
URLs O
for O
this O
are O
: O
For O
When O
we O
failed O
to O
parse O
a O
response O
, O
do O
not O
store O
the O
fake O
half-baked O
response O
( O
via O
a O
replaceHttpReply O
( O
) O
call O
) O
in O
squid-3.5-13990.patch O
and O
Do O
not O
store O
the O
fake O
half-baked O
response O
( O
via O
replaceHttpReply O
) O
in O
squid-4-14548.patch O
, O
use O
CVE-2016-2571 O
. O

When O
the O
Vary O
pattern O
presented O
by O
a O
server O
expands O
to O
more O
than O
64KB O
the O
DoS O
is O
triggered O
. O

Patch O
URLs O
that O
workaround O
3 O
of O
those O
vectors O
( O
though O
not O
fully O
solve O
) O
are O
: O
Use O
CVE-2016-2569 O
for O
both O
squid-3.5-13991.patch O
and O
squid-4-14552.patch O
. O

of O

Integer O

in O

function O
in O

and SV

. O

that O

described O
issue O

a O

bug O
, O
therefore O

Subject O
: O
[ O
oCERT-2014-007 O
] O
libvncserver O
multiple O
issues O
2014-007 O
libvncserver O
multiple O
issues O

A O
malicious O
VNC O
client O
can O
trigger O
multiple O
DoS O
conditions O
on O
the O
VNC O
server O
by O
advertising O

large O
screen O
size O
, O

message O
length O

a O
zero O
scaling O
factor O
parameter O
. O

Fixed O
version O
: O

client O
can O
trigger O
multiple O
stack-based O
buffer O
overflows O
by O
passing O
a O
long O

) O

. O

can O
trigger O

memory O
management O

by O

to O

The O

project O
, O
an O
open O
source O
library O
for O

communication O
, O
suffers O
from O
a O
number O
of O
bugs O
that O
can O
be O
potentially O
exploited O
with O
security O
impact O
. O

Various O
implementation O
issues O
resulting O
in O
remote O
code O
execution O
and/or O
DoS O
conditions O
on O
both O
the O
VNC O
server O
and O
client O
side O
have O
been O
discovered O
. O

Hello O
, O
Quick O

( O
Qemu O
) O
built O

VGA O
display O

. O

Upstream O
patch O
: O
- O
Reference O
: O
- O
This O
issue O
was O
reported O
by O
David O
Buchanan O
. O

Subject O
: O
Re O
: O
CVE-2017-13673 O
Qemu O
: O
vga O
: O
reachable O
assert O
failure O
during O
during O
display O
update O

Cisco O
Bug O
IDs O
: O
CSCve74457 O
. O

An O
attacker O
could O
exploit O
this O
vulnerability O
by O
sending O
a O
crafted O
ICA O
traffic O
through O
the O
targeted O
device O
. O

The O
Cisco O
WAAS O
could O
drop O
ICA O
traffic O
while O
the O
process O
is O
restarting O
. O

The O
vulnerability O
is O
due O
to O
improperly O
aborting O
a O
connection O
when O
an O
unexpected O
protocol O
packet O
is O
received O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
affects O
Cisco O
Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
and O
Cisco O
Virtual O
Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
vWAAS O
) O
. O

A O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
Independent O
Computing O
Architecture O
( O
ICA O
) O
accelerator O
feature O
for O
the O
Cisco O
Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
could O
allow O
an O
unauthenticated O

[ O

CVE O

202 O
Burlington O
Road O
, O

, O
MA O
01730 O

Tor SN
before SV
0.2.8.9 SV
and SV
0.2.9.x SV
before SV
0.2.9.4-alpha SV
had O
internal O
functions O
that O
were O
entitled O
to O
expect O
that O
buf_t O
data O
had O
NUL O
termination O
, O
but O
the O
implementation O
of O
or/buffers.c O
did O
not O
ensure O
that O
NUL O
termination O
was O
present O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
client O
, O
hidden O
service O
, O
relay O
, O
or O
authority O
crash O
) O
via O
crafted O
data O
. O

Closes O
ticket O
20384 O
Add O
a O
one-word O
sentinel O
value O
of O
0x0 O
at O
the O
end O
of O
each O
buf_t O
chunk O
This O
helps O
protect O
against O
bugs O
where O
any O
part O
of O
a O
buf_t O
memory O
is O
passed O
to O
a O
function O
that O
expects O
a O
NUL-terminated O
input O
. O

Prevent O
a O
class O
of O
security O
bugs O
caused O
by O
treating O
the O
contents O
of O
a O
buffer O
chunk O
as O
if O
they O
were O
a O
NUL-terminated O
string O
. O

With O
this O
CVE O
, O
any O
related O
we O
should O
still O
fix O
them O
as O
they O
occur O
patches O
can O
most O
likely O
be O
treated O
as O
defense-in-depth O
changes O
, O
and O
won O
t O
require O
separate O
CVE O
IDs O
. O

Tor O
0.2.8.9 O
backports O
a O
fix O
for O
a O
security O
hole O
in O
previous O
versions O
of O
Tor O
that O
would O
allow O
a O
remote O
attacker O
to O
crash O
a O
Tor O
client O
, O
hidden O
service O
, O
relay O
, O
or O
authority O
. O

Here O
, O
we O
will O
assign O
the O
ID O
to O
the O
broadest O
possible O
interpretation O
of O
the O
issue O
, O
which O
perhaps O
can O
be O
restated O
as O
Tor O
internal O
functions O
were O
entitled O
to O
expect O
that O
buf_t O
data O
had O
NUL O
termination O
, O
but O
the O
implementation O
of O
or/buffers.c O
did O
not O
ensure O
that O
NUL O
termination O
was O
present O
. O

With O
this O
defense O
in O
place O
, O
such O
bugs O
can O
t O
crash O
Tor O
, O
though O
we O
should O
still O
fix O
them O
as O
they O
occur O
. O

At O
least O
one O
such O
bug O
seems O
to O
be O
present O
in O
all O
currently O
used O
versions O
of O
Tor O
, O
and O
would O
allow O
an O
attacker O
to O
remotely O
crash O
most O
Tor O
instances O
, O
especially O
those O
compiled O
with O
extra O
compiler O
hardening O
. O

. O

function O

Reason O

can O

The O
functions O
which O
access O
the O

do O
not O

. O

The O
parameter O
is O
incorrectly O
validated O
leading O
to O
an O
exception O
being O
thrown O
when O
the O
fmessagelist O
function O
is O
passed O
with O
a O

parameter O
of O

a O

. O

The O
problem O
lies O
in O
that O
it O
starts O
the O
string O
construction O

of O

up O
to O
8192 O
bytes O
( O
the O
size O
of O
query O
previously O

on O
the O
stack O
. O

configuration O

is O
setup O
to O
use O
these O
for O

storage O
of O
data O
including O
credentials O
. O

This O
could O
lead O
to O
a O
stack O
overflow O
allowing O
compromise O
of O
the O
Groupware O
server O
. O

2 O
) O

. O

. O

Hi O
, O
I O
ve O
identified O

3 O

which O

Multiple O
SQL O
injection O
vulnerabilities O
in O
index.php O
in O
dev4u O
CMS O
allow O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
SQL O
commands O
via O
the O
( O
1 O
) O
seite_id O
, O
( O
2 O
) O
gruppe_id.php O
, O
and O
( O
3 O
) O
go_target O
parameters O
. O

You O
should O
work O
with O
htmlspecialchars O
( O
) O
or O
htmlentities O
( O
) O
php-function O
to O
ensure O
that O
html O
tags O
are O
not O
going O
to O
be O
executed O
. O

Fix O
None O
known O
Solution O
Edit O
the O
source O
code O
to O
ensure O
that O
input O
is O
properly O
sanitised O
. O

You O
can O
find O
more O
Information O
on O
the O
MajorSecurity O
Project O
at O

Injection O
: O

passed O
directly O
to O
the O

, O
gruppe_id.php O
and O

parameter O
in O
index.php O
is O
not O
properly O
sanitised O
before O
being O
used O
in O
a O
SQL O
query O
. O

Overview O
Due O
to O
various O
failures O
in O
sanitising O
user O
input O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
construct O
XSS O
attacks O
, O
SQL O
injection O
, O
authentication O
bypass O
, O
bypassing O
of O
default O
security O
checks O
, O
user O
spoofing O
, O
cookie O
poisoning O
and O
pollution O
of O
the O
global O
namespace O
. O

The O
protection O
is O
an O
strstr O
( O
case-sensitive O
) O
on O
UNION O
SELECT O
. O

: O

: O

to O

the O

are O

( O

) O

. O

One O

transformations O
is O
to O
convert O
relative O
image O
URLs O
into O
attachments O
using O
a O

directory O
. O

PHPMailer O

method O
applies O
transformations O
to O
an O

document O
to O
make O

usable O
as O
an O
email O
message O
body O
. O

to O
/ O
, O

relative O
image O

as O

local O

and O
added O
as O
attachments O
. O

An O
issue O
was O

in O

before SV
5.2.22 SV
. O

directory O
. O

Grassroots SN
DICOM SN
( O
aka SN

) O
before SV

to O

( O
2 O
) O

image O
file O
, O
which O
triggers O
an O

. O

Grassroots O
DICOM O
( O
GDCM O
) O
is O
a O
C++ O
library O
for O
processing O
DICOM O
medical O
images O
. O

It O
is O
advised O
to O
upgrade O
all O
GDCM O
installations O
to O
the O
latest O
stable O
release O
. O

It O
provides O
routines O
to O
view O
and O
manipulate O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
image O
formats O
and O
can O
be O
accessed O
through O
many O
popular O
programming O
languages O
like O
Python O
, O
C O
, O
Java O
and O
PHP O
. O

Vendor O
Patch O
Release O
: O
December O
23rd O
, O
2015 O
Public O
Disclosure O
: O
January O
11th O
, O
2016 O
Regards O
, O
Stelios O
Tsampas O
IT O
Security O
Researcher O
CENSUS O
S.A O
. O

GDCM SN
versions O
2.6.0 SV
and SV
2.6.1 SV
( O
and O
possibly O
previous O
versions O
) O
are O
prone O
to O
an O
out-of-bounds O
read O
vulnerability O
due O
to O
missing O
checks O
. O

The O
vulnerability O
occurs O
during O
the O
decoding O
of O
JPEG-LS O
images O
when O
the O
dimensions O
of O
the O
embedded O
JPEG-LS O
image O
( O
as O
specified O
in O
the O
JPEG O
headers O
) O
are O
smaller O
than O
the O
ones O
of O
the O
selected O
region O
( O
set O
by O
gdcm O
: O
:ImageRegionReader O
: O
:SetRegion O
and O
usually O
based O
on O
DICOM O
header O
values O
) O
. O

Contact O
: O
December O
4th O
, O

Vulnerability O
Details O

RFC O
function O

does O
not O

any O

profile O
parameter O
value O
. O

It O

by O

who O
run O

business O
on O
SAP O
operational O
systems O
. O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
Request O
SOAPpy SN
0.12.5 SV
Multiple O
Vulnerabilities O
Hello O
mitre O
, O
Background O
SOAPpy O
provides O
tools O
for O
building O
SOAP O
clients O
and O
servers.The O
goal O
of O
the O
SOAPpy O
team O
is O
to O
provide O
a O
full O
featured O
SOAP O
library O
for O
Python O
that O
is O
very O
simple O
to O
use O
and O
that O
fully O
supports O
dynamic O
interaction O
between O
clients O
and O
servers O
. O

Thanks O
& O
Best O
regards O
, O
pnig0s O

Vulnerability O
details O

SOAPpy O
use O
sax.xml O
as O
SOAP O
parser O
to O
parse O
the O
xml O
request.Sax.xml O
also O
support O
of O
setting O
a O
handler O
for O
resolving O
entity.By O
tricking O
this O
feature O
, O
it O
ll O
lead O
to O
xxe O
attack O
or O
dtd O
dos O
attack O
. O

Affect O
version O
: O
0.12.5 SV
( O
currently O
the O
lastest O
version O
) O
Type O
: O
XXE O
Attack O
& O
Billion O
laughs O
attack O

earlier SV
; O
GS748Tv4 SN
with O
firmware O
5.4.1.14 SV
; O
GS510TP SN
with O
firmware O
5.4.0.6 SV
; O
GS752TPS O
, O
GS728TPS O
, O
GS728TS O
, O
and O
GS725TS SN
with O
firmware O
5.3.0.17 SV
; O
and O
GS752TXS SN
and SN
GS728TXS SN
with O
firmware O
6.1.0.12 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
read O
encrypted O
administrator O
credentials O
and O
other O
startup O
configurations O
via O
a O
direct O
request O
to O
filesystem/startup-config O
. O

The O
outs O
instruction O
emulation O
in O
Xen SN
3.1.x SV
, O
4.2.x SV
, O
4.3.x SV
, O
and SV
earlier SV
, O
when O
using O
FS O
: O
or O
GS O
: O
segment O
override O
, O
uses O
an O
uninitialized O
variable O
as O
a O
segment O
base O
, O
which O
allows O
local O
64-bit O
PV O
guests O
to O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
( O
hypervisor O
stack O
content O
) O
via O
unspecified O
vectors O
related O
to O
stale O
data O
in O
a O
segment O
register O
. O

guests O
can O
take O

of O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

RESOLUTION O

the O
attached O
patch O
resolves O
this O
issue O
. O

the O
segment O
register O
contains O
stale O
data O
) O
. O

VULNERABLE O
SYSTEMS O
Xen SN
3.1.x SV
and SV
later SV
are O
vulnerable O
. O

MITIGATION O
Running O
only O
HVM O
or O
32-bit O
PV O
guests O
will O
avoid O
this O
issue O
. O

CREDITS O
This O
issue O
was O
discovered O
by O
Coverity O
Scan O
and O
Matthew O
Daley O
. O

ISSUE O
DESCRIPTION O
The O
emulation O
of O
the O
outs O
instruction O
for O
64-bit O
PV O
guests O
uses O
an O
uninitialized O
variable O
as O
the O
segment O
base O
for O
the O
source O
data O
if O
an O
FS O
: O
or O
GS O
: O
segment O
override O
is O
used O
, O
and O
if O
the O
segment O
descriptor O
the O
respective O
non-null O
selector O
in O
the O
corresponding O
selector O
register O
points O
to O
can O
not O
be O
read O
by O
the O
emulation O
code O
( O
this O
is O
possible O
if O
the O
segment O
register O
was O
loaded O
before O
a O
more O
recent O
GDT O
or O
LDT O
update O
, O
i.e O
. O

Other O
methods O
for O
indirectly O
deducing O
information O
also O
exist O
. O

A O
malicious O
guest O
might O
be O
able O
to O
get O
hold O
of O
contents O
of O
the O
hypervisor O
stack O
, O
through O
the O
fault O
address O
passed O
to O
the O
page O
fault O
handler O
if O
the O
outs O
raises O
such O
a O
fault O
( O
which O
is O
mostly O
under O
guest O
control O
) O
. O

password O
) O
. O

- O

: O

Background O
: O
This O

allows O

Disable O

from O

Easily O
exploitable O
vulnerability O
allows O
low O
privileged O
attacker O
having O
Local O
Logon O
privilege O
with O
logon O
to O
the O
infrastructure O
where O

to O

RDBMS O
Security O
. O

Vulnerability O
in O

component O
of O

Server O
. O

supported O

that O

. O

. O

in O

on O

in O

allows O

The O

protocol O
does O
not O
consider O
the O

of O

in O

Intel SN
Crosswalk SN
before SV
19.49.514.5 SV
, O
20.x SV
before SV
20.50.533.11 SV
, O
21.x SV
before SV
21.51.546.0 SV
, O
and SV
22.x SV
before SV

interprets O
a O

of O
one O
invalid O
X.509 O

to O
mean O
that O

, O

to O

and O
obtain O
sensitive O
information O
via O
a O

certificate O
. O

The O
library O
also O
bridges O
some O
of O
the O
common O
APIs O
and O
services O
from O
the O
Javascript O
code O
in O

. O

allows O
the O
certificate O
, O
that O
choice O
is O
remembered O
going O
forward O
and O
from O
that O

in O
, O

with O
invalid O
SSL O
certificates O
are O
accepted O
by O
the O
application O
, O
and O
are O
not O
rechecked O
. O

Example O
of O
error O
dialog O
The O
fix O
changes O
the O
behaviour O
to O
generate O
a O
programmatic O
error O
message O
not O
visible O
to O

user O
about O
an O
invalid O

. O

This O

has O
been O

in O

of O
Crosswalk O
and O
all O

of O

- O
19.49.514.5 O
( O

) O
- O
20.50.533.11 O
( O

) O
- O

( O

) O

( O

) O

. O

Vulnerability O
Details O
The O
Crosswalk O
Project O
, O
created O
by O
Intel O
s O
Open O
Source O
Technology O
Center O
, O
allows O
mobile O
developers O
to O
use O
HTML O
, O
CSS O
and O
Javascript O
to O
develop O
and O
deploy O
mobile O
apps O
across O
multiple O
platforms O
from O
the O
same O
codebase O
. O

when O
an O
invalid O
or O
self-signed O
SSL O
certificate O
is O
used O
during O
communication O
with O
the O
server O
, O
the O
underlying O
library O
displays O
a O
prompt O
to O
the O
user O
asking O
them O
to O
grant O
permission O
or O
deny O
permission O
to O
this O
certificate O
. O

This O
behaviour O
could O
subject O
applications O
developed O
using O
this O
library O
to O
SSL O
MITM O
attacks O
. O

The O
project O
supports O
deployment O
to O
iOS O
, O
Windows O
Phone O
and O
Android O
. O

This O
applies O
even O
to O
connections O
over O
different O
WiFi O
hotspots O
and O
different O
certificates O
. O

This O
may O
allow O
a O
network-level O
attacker O
to O
mount O
MITM O
attack O
using O
invalid O
SSL O
certificate O
and O
capture O
sensitive O
data O
. O

Summary O

for O

. O

inside O

About O

of O

a O
local O
malicious O
application O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
within O
the O
context O
of O
a O
privileged O
process O
. O

: O
5.0.2 SV
, O

, O

, O

, O

. O

Product O
: O

. O

The O
kernel-mode O
drivers O
in O
Microsoft SN
Windows SN
Server SV
2008 SV
SP2 SV
and SV
R2 SV
SP1 SV
, O
Windows SN
7 SV

, O
Windows SN
8.1 SV
, O

Server SV
2012 SV
Gold SV
and SV

, O

, O
Windows SN
10 SV
Gold SV
, O

, O
1607 SV
, O

, O
and O
Windows SN
Server SV
2016 SV
allow O
local O
users O
to O
gain O
privileges O
via O
a O
crafted O
application O
, O
aka O
Win32k O
Elevation O
of O
Privilege O
Vulnerability O
. O

References O
: O
N-CVE-2016-6790 O
. O

Android O
ID O
: O
A-31251628 O
. O

Versions O
: O
Kernel-3.18 O
. O

An O
elevation O
of O
privilege O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
NVIDIA O
libomx O
library O
( O
libnvomx O
) O
could O
enable O
a O
local O
malicious O
application O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
within O
the O
context O
of O
a O
privileged O
process O
. O

Stack-based O
buffer O
overflow O
in O
the O
FascistGecosUser O
function O
in O
lib/fascist.c O
in O
cracklib O
allows O
local O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
application O
crash O
) O
or O
gain O
privileges O
via O
a O
long O
GECOS O
field O
, O
involving O
longbuffer O
. O

To O
trigger O
the O
flaw O
, O
you O
need O
a O
specially-crafted O
long O
GECOS O
field O
, O
which O
can O
be O
done O
by O
a O
local O
user O
on O
the O
system O
. O

( O
such O
as O
passwd O
application O
which O
runs O
suid O
root O
) O
All O
versions O
of O
the O
cracklib O
library O
shipped O
with O
Red O
Hat O
Enterprise O
Linux O
are O
compiled O
with O
FORTIFY_SOURCE O
, O
which O
detects O
the O
buffer-overflow O
and O
aborts O
the O
application O
safely O
. O

A O
proposed O
patch O
is O
available O
at O
: O
This O
flaw O
was O
assigned O
CVE-2016-6318 O
and O
it O
was O
previously O
disclosed O
via O
linux-distros O
mailing O
list O
. O

: O
Tue O
, O

The O
attacker O
then O
needs O
to O
run O
some O
utility O
which O
uses O
cracklib O
to O
process O
this O
long O
GECOS O
field O
on O
the O
system O
. O

However O
, O
there O
may O
be O
other O
applications O
, O
distributions O
which O
dont O
compile O
cracklib O
with O

, O

can O
lead O
to O
easy O
code O
exec O
or O

privsec O
. O

Therefore O
the O
maximum O
impact O
of O
this O
flaw O
is O
application O
crash O
. O

CVE-2016-1240 O
- O
Tomcat O
packaging O
on O
Debian-based O
distros O
- O
Local O
Root O
Privilege O
Escalation O

Integer O

in O

in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
before SV

to O

via O

Subject O
: O

- O

kernel O

in O

decoder O
for O

files O

An O
issue O
with O
ASN.1 O
DER O
decoder O
was O
reported O
that O
could O
lead O
to O
memory O
corruptions O
, O
possible O

escalation O
, O
or O
complete O

of O
service O
via O
x509 O
certificate O
DER O
files O
. O

Tags O
with O
indefinite O
length O
can O
be O
used O
to O
corrupt O

and O

pointers O
in O

in O

: O
... O

( O

= O

Subject O

. O

kernel_crashdump O
in O
Apport SN
before SV
2.19 SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
disk O
consumption O
) O
or O
possibly O
gain O
privileges O
via O
a O
( O
1 O
) O
symlink O
or O
( O
2 O
) O
hard O
link O
attack O
on O
/var/crash/vmcore.log O
. O

Also O
opening O
of O
input O
file O
does O
not O
care O
about O
links O
. O

For O
kernel O
crashes O
, O
upstart O
or O
SysV O
init O
invokes O
the O
program O
/usr/share/apport/kernel_crashdump O
at O
boot O
to O
prepare O
crash O
dump O
files O
for O
sending O
. O

As O
the O
crash O
dump O
directory O
/var/crash O
is O
world O
writable O
and O
kernel_crashdump O
performs O
file O
access O
in O
unsafe O
manner O
, O
any O
local O
user O
may O
trigger O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
or O
escalate O
to O
root O
privileges O
. O

If O
symlink O
and O
hardlink O
protection O
is O
enabled O
( O
which O
should O
be O
the O
default O
for O
any O
modern O
system O
) O
, O
only O
denial O
of O
service O
is O
possible O
. O

This O
action O
is O
performed O
with O
root O
privileges O
. O

Problematic O
syscall O
in O
kernel_crashdump O
is O
: O
open O
( O
/var/crash/linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic.0.crash O
, O
O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC|O_LARGEFILE|O_CLOEXEC O
, O
0666 O
) O
= O
30 O
... O
open O
( O
/var/crash/vmcore.log O
, O
O_RDONLY|O_LARGEFILE|O_CLOEXEC O
) O
= O
31 O
Thus O
the O
output O
file O
is O
opened O
unconditionally O
and O
without O
O_EXCL O
or O
O_NOFOLLOW O
. O

Apport SN
2.19 SV
( O
Ubuntu SN
15.04 SV
) O
- O
Local O
Privilege O
Escalation O

Untrusted O
search O
path O
vulnerability O
in O
Ecava SN
IntegraXor SN
SCADA SN
Server SN
before SV
4.2.4488 SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
gain O
privileges O
via O
a O
renamed O
DLL O
in O
the O
default O
install O
directory O
. O

The O
IPC O
channel O
in O
Cisco SN
AnyConnect SN
Secure SN
Mobility SN
Client SN
4.0 SV
( O
.00051 SV
) O
and SV
earlier SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
write O
to O
arbitrary O
userspace O
memory O
locations O
, O
and O
consequently O
gain O
privileges O
, O
via O
crafted O
messages O
, O
aka O
Bug O
ID O
CSCus79195 O
. O

The O
em_sysenter O
function O
in O
arch/x86/kvm/emulate.c O
in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
before SV
3.18.5 SV
, O
when O
the O
guest O
OS O
lacks O
SYSENTER O
MSR O
initialization O
, O
allows O
guest O
OS O
users O
to O
gain O
guest O
OS O
privileges O
or O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
guest O
OS O
crash O
) O
by O
triggering O
use O
of O
a O
16-bit O
code O
segment O
for O
emulation O
of O
a O
SYSENTER O
instruction O
. O

Regardless O
to O
SMP O
, O
it O
appears O
that O
an O
attack O
can O
also O
be O
launched O
on O
UP O
, O
if O
the O
guest O
is O
configured O
to O
run O
on O
Intel O
VCPU O
while O
the O
real O
CPU O
is O
AMD O
. O

Instead O
, O
it O
sets O
the O
guest O
instruction O
pointer O
to O
zero O
and O
changes O
the O
code O
privilege O
level O
( O
CPL O
) O
to O
zero O
( O
privileged O
) O
. O

In O
these O
systems O
, O
guest O
DoS O
is O
possible O
. O

The O
bug O
existed O
since O
the O
introduction O
of O
SYSENTER O
emulation O
( O
em_sysenter O
function O
on O
recent O
Linux O
releases O
) O
, O
in O
commit O
8c60435261deaefeb53ce3222d04d7d5bea81296 O
, O
which O
is O
present O
in O
Linux SN
2.6.32 SV
- SV
3.18 SV
. O

However O
, O
it O
can O
not O
be O
used O
for O
privilege O
escalation O
if O
the O
guest O
can O
not O
access O
the O
first O
memory O
page O
, O
whose O
virtual O
address O
is O
zero O
. O

Date O
: O
Tue O
, O
27 O
Jan O
2015 O
14:17:22 O
+0200 O
From O
: O
Nadav O
Amit O
< O
nadav.amit O
@ O
... O
il.com O
To O
: O
oss-security O
@ O
... O
ts.openwall.com O
Cc O
: O
Red O
Hat O
Product O
Security O
< O
secalert O
@ O
... O
hat.com O
> O
, O
Paolo O
Bonzini O
< O
pbonzini O
@ O
... O
hat.com O

AMD O
CPUs O
do O
not O
support O
SYSENTER O
in O
compatibility O
mode O
; O
KVM O
would O
emulate O
them O
so O
the O
VCPU O
would O
behave O
as O
if O
the O
physical O
CPU O
is O
Intel O
. O

KVM O
does O
not O
check O
under O
these O
conditions O
that O
the O
selector O
IA32_SYSENTER_CS O
is O
not O
zero O
, O
and O
does O
not O
generate O
a O
GP O
exception O
as O
real O
hardware O
does O
. O

The O
PoC O
therefore O
takes O
an O
argument O
that O
tells O
it O
how O
many O
cycles O
to O
wait O
before O
creating O
the O
race O
that O
fools O
the O
hypervisor O
into O
emulating O
a O
SYSENTER O
instruction O
. O

< O
pthread.h O
include O
< O

< O

< O

define O
MMAP_EXPLOIT O

( O
.pushsection O
.wtext O
, O

: O

, O

: O

( O

) O

badcode O

.popsection O
) O
; O

int O
sync O
= O
0 O
; O

unsigned O
short O
badcode O
[ O
] O
; O
extern O
volatile O

; O

; O
static O
void O
proc O
( O
void O
ignored O
) O
{ O
sync O
= O
1 O
; O
while O
( O
true O
) O
{ O
volatile O
int O
cycles O
; O
badcode O
= O
0x340f O
; O
sysenter O
asm O
volatile O
( O
clflush O
( O
% O
0 O
r O
( O
badcode O
) O
) O
; O
for O
( O
cycles O
= O

; O
cycles O
< O

; O
cycles O

NULL O
; O
} O
int O
main O
( O
int O
argc O
, O
char O
argv O
[ O
] O
) O
{ O
int O
res O
; O
void O

; O

pth O
; O

user_desc O
d O
= O
{ O
.entry_number O
= O
1 O
, O
.base_addr O
= O
( O
unsigned O
long O
) O
& O
badcode O
, O
.limit O
= O
0xfffffu O
, O
.seg_32bit O
= O
0 O
, O
.contents O
= O
2 O
, O

Windows O
and O
distro O
Linux O
guest O
OSes O
should O
be O
safe O
. O

Using O
the O
PoC O
I O
manages O
to O
crash O
the O
guest O
Linux O
kernel O
, O
causing O
a O
double O
fault O
; O
and O
to O
demonstrate O
privilege O
escalation O
by O
successfully O
executing O
xc3 O
xa2 O
xc2 O
x80 O
xc2 O
x9cint O
$ O
2 O
xc3 O
xa2 O
xc2 O
x80 O
xc2 O
x9d O
that O
caused O
spurious O
NMI O
. O

As O
a O
result O
of O
these O
limitations O
the O
attack O
is O
only O
possible O
in O
when O
the O
guest O
uses O
certain O
OSes O
, O
for O
instance O
, O
Linux O
which O
was O
built O
without O
CONFIG_IA32_EMULATION O
( O
support O
for O
legacy O
32-bit O
programs O
) O
or O
FreeBSD O
. O

This O
is O
likely O
to O
trigger O
the O
vulnerability O
. O

Details O
: O
The O
success O
of O
such O
an O
attack O
and O
its O
results O
depend O
on O
the O
guest O
OS O
. O

The O
attack O
can O
be O
launched O
by O
tricking O
the O
hypervisor O
to O
emulate O
a O
SYSENTER O
instruction O
in O
16-bit O
mode O
, O
if O
the O
guest O
OS O
does O
not O
initialize O
the O
SYSENTER O
MSRs O
. O

An O
attack O
can O
be O
launched O
on O
an O
SMP O
guest O
, O
using O
guest O
code O
that O
tricks O
KVM O
into O
emulating O
the O
SYSENTER O
instruction O
. O

Note O
that O
the O
attack O
can O
only O
be O
issued O
under O
very O
certain O
conditions O
( O
see O
the O
details O
below O
) O
. O

The O
PoC O
is O
not O
fully O
automatic O
since O
dealing O
with O
signals O
in O
16-bit O
code O
is O
annoying O
. O

Privilege O
escalation O
attack O
requires O
that O
in O
addition O
guest O
processes O
would O
be O
able O
to O
access O
address O
zero O
. O

It O
is O
inapplicable O
if O
the O
guest O
OS O
initializes O
the O
SYSENTER O
MSRs O
, O
as O
Linux O
usually O
does O
. O

On O
my O
system O
, O
using O
100 O
as O
an O
input O
results O
produces O
the O
exploit O
. O

xc3 O
xa2 O
xc2 O
x80 O
xc2 O
x94 O
KVM O
SYSENTER O
EXPLOIT O
Some O
of O
the O
code O
of O
the O
PoC O
was O
borrowed O
from O
code O
that O
was O
written O
by O
Andy O
Lutomirski O
for O
another O
vulnerability O
. O

The O
attached O
PoC O
does O
just O
that O
. O

Red-hat O
assigned O
CVE-2015-0239 O
for O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

It O
first O
writes O
a O
UD2 O
instruction O
, O
causing O
a O
UD O
exception O
and O
a O
subsequent O
VM-exit O
, O
and O
then O
tries O
from O
another O
thread O
to O
rewrite O
the O
UD2 O
instruction O
with O
SYSENTER O
just O
before O
KVM O
emulates O
the O
instruction O
. O

Subject O
: O
KVM O
SYSENTER O
emulation O
vulnerability O
- O
CVE-2015-0239 O
Linux SN
2.6.32 SV
- SV
3.18 SV
that O
runs O
KVM O
may O
enable O
a O
malicious O
guest O
process O
to O
crash O
the O
guest O
OS O
or O
launch O
a O
privilege O
escalation O
attack O
on O
the O
guest O
. O

To O
fix O
the O
bug O
, O
you O
can O
apply O
the O
following O
patch O
- O
There O
are O
no O
known O
exploits O
of O
the O
vulnerability O
. O

For O
Linux O
guest O
, O
this O
requirement O
means O
the O
the O
kernel O
parameter O
vm.mmap_min_addr O
is O
set O
to O
zero O
. O

If O
the O
MSRs O
were O
not O
initialized O
, O
it O
can O
be O
used O
to O
crash O
the O
guest O
OS O
or O
for O
privilege O
escalation O
. O

Subject O
: O
KVM O

emulation O
vulnerability O
- O
CVE-2015-0239 O

/sbin/ifwatchd O
in O
BlackBerry SN

Neutrino SN

6.4.x SV
and SV

allows O
local O

to O
gain O

by O

an O
arbitrary O
program O
name O
as O
a O

argument O
. O

Any O
user O
can O
launch O

and O
provide O
arbitrary O
up/down O
scripts O
. O

Once O
the O

is O
in O

will O
be O
killed O
to O
drop O
the O
user O
into O

. O

Vendor O
: O
The O
Apache O

If O

Mark O

Affected O
: O

Description O
: O

for O

. O
