Linux SN
Kernel SN
2.4.4 SV
< SV
2.4.37.4 SV
2.6.0 SV
< SV
2.6.30.4 SV
- O
Sendpage O
Local O
Privilege O
Escalation O
( O
Metasploit O
) O

Mirror O
: O
( O
android-root-20090816.tar.gz O
) O
milw0rm.com O
[ O
2009-08-18 O
] O

Source O
for O
exploiting O
CVE-2009-2692 O
on O
Android O
; O
Hole O
is O
closed O
in O
Android O
kernels O
released O
August O
2009 O
or O
later O
. O

Linux SN
Kernel SN
2.x SV
( O
Android O
) O
- O
ock_sendpage O
( O
) O
Local O
Privilege O
Escalation O

Linux O
NULL O
pointer O
dereference O
due O
to O
incorrect O
proto_ops O
initializations O
- O
In O
the O
Linux O
kernel O
, O
each O
socket O
has O
an O
associated O
struct O
of O
operations O
called O
proto_ops O
which O
contain O
pointers O
to O
functions O
implementing O
various O
features O
, O
such O
as O
accept O
, O
bind O
, O
shutdown O
, O
and O
so O
on O
. O

Solution O
Linus O
committed O
a O
patch O
correcting O
this O
issue O
on O
13th O
August O
2009. O
t O
; O
h=e694958388c50148389b0e9b9e9e8945cf0f1b98 O
Credit O
This O
bug O
was O
discovered O
by O
Tavis O
Ormandy O
and O
Julien O
Tinnes O
of O
the O
Google O
Security O
Team O
. O

Successful O
exploitation O
will O
lead O
to O
complete O
attacker O
control O
of O
the O
system O
. O

We O
have O
identified O
several O
examples O
where O
the O
initialization O
is O
incomplete O
: O
- O
The O
SOCKOPS_WRAP O
macro O
defined O
in O
include/linux/net.h O
, O
which O
appears O
correct O
at O
first O
glance O
, O
was O
actually O
affected O
. O

In O
order O
to O
exploit O
this O
, O
an O
attacker O
would O
create O
a O
mapping O
at O
address O
zero O
containing O
code O
to O
be O
executed O
with O
privileges O
of O
the O
kernel O
, O
and O
then O
trigger O
a O
vulnerable O
operation O
using O
a O
sequence O
like O
this O
int O
fdin O
= O
mkstemp O
( O
template O
) O
; O
int O
fdout O
= O
socket O
( O
PF_PPPOX O
, O
SOCK_DGRAM O
, O
0 O
) O
; O
unlink O
( O
template O
) O
; O
ftruncate O
( O
fdin O
, O
PAGE_SIZE O
) O
; O
sendfile O
( O
fdout O
, O
fdin O
, O
NULL O
, O
PAGE_SIZE O
Please O
note O
, O
sendfile O
( O
) O
is O
just O
one O
of O
many O
ways O
to O
cause O
a O
sendpage O
operation O
on O
a O
socket O
. O

This O
is O
not O
always O
a O
security O
issue O
, O
as O
the O
kernel O
validates O
the O
pointers O
at O
the O
call O
site O
, O
such O
as O
this O
example O
from O
sock_splice_read O
: O
static O
ssize_t O
sock_splice_read O
( O
struct O
file O
file O
, O
loff_t O
ppos O
, O
struct O
pipe_inode_info O
pipe O
, O
size_t O
len O
, O
unsigned O
int O
flags O
) O
{ O
struct O
socket O
sock O
= O
file- O
> O
private_data O
; O
if O
( O
unlikely O
( O
! O
sock- O
> O
ops- O
> O
splice_read O
) O
) O
return O
-EINVAL O
; O
return O
sock- O
> O
ops- O
> O
splice_read O
( O
sock O
, O
ppos O
, O
pipe O
, O
len O
, O
flags O
) O
; O
} O
But O
we O
have O
found O
an O
example O
where O
this O
is O
not O
the O
case O
; O
the O
sock_sendpage O
( O
) O
routine O
does O
not O
validate O
the O
function O
pointer O
is O
valid O
before O
dereferencing O
it O
, O
and O
therefore O
relies O
on O
the O
correct O
initialization O
of O
the O
proto_ops O
structure O
. O

It O
should O
also O
be O
noted O
that O
all O
kernels O
up O
to O
2.6.30.2 O
are O
vulnerable O
to O
published O
attacks O
against O
mmap_min_addr O
. O

taviso O
( O
at O
) O
sdf.lonestar O
( O
dot O
) O
org O
[ O
email O
concealed O
] O
| O
finger O
me O
for O
my O
gpg O
key O
. O

If O
an O
operation O
on O
a O
particular O
socket O
is O
unimplemented O
, O
they O
are O
expected O
to O
point O
the O
associated O
function O
pointer O
to O
predefined O
stubs O
, O
for O
example O
if O
the O
accept O
operation O
is O
undefined O
it O
would O
point O
to O
sock_no_accept O
( O
) O
. O

However O
, O
administrators O
should O
be O
aware O
that O
LSM O
based O
mandatory O
access O
control O
systems O
, O
such O
as O
SELinux O
, O
may O
alter O
this O
functionality O
. O

Mitigation O
Recent O
kernels O
with O
mmap_min_addr O
support O
may O
prevent O
exploitation O
if O
the O
sysctl O
vm.mmap_min_addr O
is O
set O
above O
zero O
. O

- O
Initializations O
were O
missing O
in O
other O
protocols O
, O
including O
PF_BLUETOOTH O
, O
PF_IUCV O
, O
PF_INET6 O
( O
with O
IPPROTO_SCTP O
) O
, O
PF_PPPOX O
and O
PF_ISDN O
. O

However O
, O
we O
have O
found O
that O
this O
is O
not O
always O
the O
case O
and O
some O
of O
these O
pointers O
are O
left O
uninitialized O
. O

Affected O
Software O
All O
Linux SN
2.4/2.6 SV
versions O
since O
May O
2001 O
are O
believed O
to O
be O
affected O
: O
- O
Linux SN
2.4 SV
, O
from SV
2.4.4 SV
up SV
to SV
and SV
including SV
2.4.37.4 SV
- O
Linux SN
2.6 SV
, O
from SV
2.6.0 SV
up SV
to SV
and SV
including SV
2.6.30.4 SV
Consequences O
This O
issue O
is O
easily O
exploitable O
for O
local O
privilege O
escalation O
. O

This O
includes O
PF_APPLETALK O
, O
PF_IPX O
, O
PF_IRDA O
, O
PF_X25 O
and O
PF_AX25 O
families O
. O

Linux O
NULL O
pointer O
dereference O
due O
to O
incorrect O
proto_ops O
initializations O

This O
file O
is O
distributed O
under O
the O
terms O
of O
the O
MIT O
License O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
rPath O
Linux O
does O
not O
include O
two O
other O
mechanisms O
by O
which O
this O
vulnerability O
has O
been O
exploited O
( O
pulseaudio O
and O
SELinux O
policy O
permitting O
access O
to O
address O
0 O
) O
. O

copy O
is O
available O
at O

the O

package O
to O
the O

libraries O
, O
even O
if O

are O
incompatible O
with O
the O
current O
versions O
. O

rPath O
Linux O
is O
configured O
by O
default O
with O
vm.mmap_min_addr=65536 O
and O
so O
is O
not O
vulnerable O
by O
default O
. O

Description O
: O
Previous O
versions O
of O
the O
kernel O
have O
a O
weakness O
which O
in O
a O
non-default O
configuration O
( O
if O
vm.mmap_min_addr O
is O
0 O
) O
allows O
normal O
users O
processes O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
as O
the O
root O
user O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
this O
enables O
user O
programs O
to O
use O
the O
libraries O
included O
in O
open-vm-tools O
. O

References O

JRE O
Tomcat O
ntp O
kernel O
python O
bind O
libxml O
and O
libxml2 O
curl O
gnutil O
- O
6 O
. O

A O
malicious O
, O
remote O
server O
could O
send O
a O
specially-crafted O
reply O
to O
an O
ntpq O
request O
that O
could O
crash O
ntpq O
or O
, O
potentially O
, O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
with O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
user O
running O
the O
ntpq O
command O
. O

c. O
Third O
party O
library O
update O
for O
ntp O
. O

ESXi SN
3.5 SV
and O
ESXi SN
4.0 SV
have O
a O
ntp O
client O
that O
is O
affected O
by O
the O
following O
security O
issue O
. O

A O
Document O
Type O
Definition O
( O
DTD O
) O
defines O
the O
legal O
syntax O
( O
and O
also O
which O
elements O
can O
be O
used O
) O
for O
certain O
types O
of O
files O
, O
such O
as O
XML O
files O
. O

The O
currently O
installed O
version O
of O
Tomcat O
depends O
on O
your O
patch O
deployment O
history O
. O

The O
NTP O
security O
issue O
identified O
by O
CVE-2009-0159 O
is O
not O
relevant O
for O
ESXi O
3.5 O
and O
ESXi O
4.0 O
. O

The O
service O
consoles O
of O
ESX O
2.5.5 O
, O
ESX O
3.0.3 O
and O
ESX O
3.5 O
are O
not O
affected O
by O
CVE-2009-1252 O
. O

A O
remote O
attacker O
could O
use O
this O
flaw O
to O
send O
a O
specially-crafted O
dynamic O
update O
packet O
that O
could O
cause O
named O
to O
exit O
with O
an O
assertion O
failure O
. O

The O
following O
table O
lists O
what O
action O
remediates O
the O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
Service O
Console O
( O
column O
4 O
) O
if O
a O
solution O
is O
available O
. O

Strings O
generated O
by O
this O
function O
were O
not O
properly O
NULL-terminated O
, O
which O
could O
possibly O
cause O
disclosure O
of O
data O
stored O
in O
the O
memory O
of O
a O
Python O
application O
using O
this O
function O
. O

for O

Service O

, O

, O

, O

, O

, O

. O

buffer O
and O
integer O
overflow O
flaws O
were O
found O
in O
the O
Python O

string O
processing O
and O

and O
string O
object O

. O

Protocol O
( O

) O
is O
used O
to O

a O

with O

time O
source O
. O

When O
the O
assert O
( O
) O
system O
call O
was O
disabled O
, O
an O
input O
sanitization O
flaw O
was O
revealed O
in O

Python O
string O
object O
implementation O
that O
led O
to O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
. O

If O
an O
attacker O
is O
able O
to O
get O
a O
carefully-crafted O
certificate O
signed O
by O
a O
Certificate O
Authority O
trusted O
by O
an O
application O
using O
GnuTLS O
, O
the O
attacker O
could O
use O
the O
certificate O
during O
a O
man-in-the-middle O
attack O
and O
potentially O
confuse O
the O
application O
into O
accepting O
it O
by O
mistake O
. O

Solution O
Please O
review O
the O
patch/release O
notes O
for O
your O
product O
and O
version O
and O
verify O
the O
md5sum O
of O
your O
downloaded O
file O
. O

remote O
attacker O
could O
provide O
a O
specially-crafted O
XML O
file O
, O
which O
once O
opened O
by O
a O
local O
, O
unsuspecting O
user O
, O
would O
lead O
to O
denial O
of O
service O
. O

The O
PGPwded O
device O
driver O
( O
aka O

) O
in O
PGP SN
Corporation SN
PGP SN
Desktop SV
9.0.6 SV
build SV
6060 SV
and SV
9.9.0 SV
build SV
397 SV
allows O

service O
( O

via O

that O

of O

, O
related O
to O
a O
Driver O
Collapse O
. O

{ O
DOT O
} O
com O
Website O
Since O
we O
had O
publishing O
problems O
, O
we O
used O
spaces O
between O
escape O
< O
char O
and O
the O
include O
file O
as O
shown O
here O
: O
include O
< O
windows.h O
> O
, O
to O
compile O
you O
have O
to O
delete O
the O
space O
. O

include O
< O
windows.h O
include O
< O
stdio.h O

) O

Affected O
Software O
F-Secure SN
Anti-Virus SN
Client SN
Security SN
Version O
6.02 SV
2 O
) O
Severity O
Rating O
: O
Low O
risk O
Impact O
: O

read O

, O

. O

When O

Server O

. O

The O

is O

of O
format O
strings O
when O
processing O
Management O
Server O
name O
field O
. O

Layered O
Defense O
Research O
Advisory O
: O
F-Secure SN
Anti-Virus SN
Client SN
Security SN
6.02 SV
Format O
String O
Vulnerability O

Unspecified O

in O

, O

( O
1 O
) O

Date O

CVE O
Name O
: O
CVE-2007-0005 O
Introduction O
: O
The O
Linux O
drivers O
for O
the O
Omnikey O
CardMan O
4040 O
smartcard O
reader O
contain O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
vulnerability O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
a O
system O
can O
be O
set O
up O
to O
allow O
access O
to O
the O
device O
for O
a O
special O
user O
or O
group O
in O
order O
to O
increase O
security O
by O
running O
the O
userland O
drivers O
without O
root O
privileges O
. O

A O
malicious O
or O
buggy O
device O
sending O
more O
than O
512 O
bytes O
can O
overflow O
the O
driver O
read O
buffer O
to O
the O
same O
effect O
. O

When O
calling O
write O
( O
) O
with O
a O
buffer O
larger O
than O
512 O
bytes O
, O
the O
driver O
write O
buffer O
overflows O
, O
allowing O
to O
overwrite O
the O
EIP O
and O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
with O
kernel O
privileges O
. O

still O
haven O
t O
seen O
the O
CVE O
, O
but O
it O
seems O
that O
it O
is O
a O
report O
against O
a O
fork O
of O
libpng O
, O
that O
had O
fallen O
several O
years O
out-of-date O
, O
and O
the O
CVE O
is O
just O
a O
private O
catch-all O
for O
updating O
the O
fork O
to O
current O
libpng O
status O
. O

It O
hard O
to O
do O
that O
when O
a O
surprise O
CVE O
was O
never O
sent O
to O
the O
project O
, O
for O
example O

- O

( O
H O
) O

just O
appeared O
in O

security O
bulletin O
. O

Also O

easy O
to O
contact O
them O
helps O
, O
the O
harder O
you O
make O
it O
for O
a O
security O
researcher O
to O
deal O
with O
you O
, O
the O
less O
likely O
they O
are O
to O
. O

It O
claims O
that O
libpng O
has O
a O
bug O
that O
allows O
privilidge O
escalation O
and O
was O
reported O
3 O
Dec O
2015 O
. O

All O
I O
ve O
been O
able O
to O
find O
out O
is O
that O
it O
is O
a O
reserved O
CVE O
, O
with O
no O

as O
to O
who O
reserved O
it O
. O

, O

We O
can O
actually O
pass O
any O
task O
port O
as O
the O
owningTask O
which O
means O
that O
if O
the O
userclient O
doesn O
t O
take O
a O
reference O
we O
can O
easily O
pass O
the O
task O
port O
for O
another O
task O
, O
kill O
that O
task O
( O
freeing O
the O
task O
struct O
) O
then O
get O
the O
user O
client O
to O
use O
the O
free O
d O
task O
struct O
. O

This O
PoC O
forks O
off O
a O
child O
which O
sends O
the O
parent O
back O
its O
task O
port O
then O
spins O
. O

The O
parent O
then O
creates O
a O
new O
IOBluetoothHCIUserClient O
passing O
the O
child O
task O
port O
as O
the O
owningTask O
then O
sigkills O
the O
child O
( O
freeing O
it O
task O
struct O
. O
) O

tested O
on O
OS SN
X SN
10.11.5 SV
( O
15F34 SV
) O
on O
MacBookAir5,2 O
ianbeer O
OS O
X O
kernel O
use-after-free O
in O
IOBluetoothFamily.kext O
When O
you O
create O
a O
new O
IOKit O
user O
client O
from O
userspace O
you O
call O
: O
kern_return_t O
IOServiceOpen O
( O
io_service_t O
service O
, O
task_port_t O
owningTask O
, O
uint32_t O
type O
, O
io_connect_t O
connect O
) O
; O
The O
owningTask O
mach O
port O
gets O
converted O
into O
a O
task O
struct O
pointer O
by O
the O
MIG O
deserialization O
code O
which O
then O
takes O
a O
reference O
on O
the O
task O
, O
calls O
is_io_service_open_extended O
passing O
the O
task O
struct O
then O
drops O
its O
reference O
. O

If O
those O
services O
want O
to O
keep O
a O
pointer O
to O
the O
owningTask O
then O
it O
very O
important O
that O
they O
actually O
take O
a O
reference O
. O

build O
: O
clang O
-o O
bluetooth_uaf O
bluetooth_uaf.c O
-framework O
IOKit O
You O
should O
set O
gzalloc_min=1024 O
gzalloc_max=2048 O
or O
similar O
to O
actually O
fault O
on O
the O
UaF O
- O
otherwise O
you O
might O
see O
some O
weird O
panics O
! O

The O
IOMemoryDescriptor O
code O
does O
sufficiently O
weird O
stuff O
with O
the O
task O
struct O
and O
the O
memory O
map O
hanging O
off O
it O
that O
this O
bug O
is O
clearly O
exploitable O
as O
just O
a O
plain O
memory O
corruption O
issue O
but O
can O
probably O
be O
leveraged O
for O
more O
interesting O
logic O
stuff O
too O
. O

Note O
that O
bluetooth O
does O
have O
to O
be O
turned O
on O
for O
this O
PoC O
to O
work O
! O

This O
pointer O
is O
then O
used O
in O
IOBluetoothHCIUserClient O
: O
:SimpleDispatchWL O
to O
build O
and O
manipulate O

. O

is_io_service_open_extended O
will O
then O
call O
through O
to O
any O
overriden O
newUserClient O
or O
initWithTask O
methods O
implemented O
by O
the O
service O
. O

( O

a O

struct O
pointer O

a O
reference O

Source O
: O
you O
create O
a O
new O

user O

from O

you O
call O
: O

( O

before SV
3.1.3 SV
is O
affected O

The O
issue O
involves O
the O
Kernel O
component O
. O

fixes O
One O
approach O
to O
fixing O
this O
issue O
would O
be O
to O
do O
something O
similar O
to O
OSObjects O
which O
use O
a O
saturating O
reference O
count O
and O
leak O
the O
object O
if O
the O
reference O
count O
saturates O
I O
fear O
there O
are O
a O
great O
number O
of O
similar O
issues O
so O
just O
fixing O
this O
once O
instance O
may O
not O
be O
enough O
. O

ipc_kmsg_free O
will O
only O
destroy O
the O
message O
header O
, O
so O
if O
the O
message O
had O
any O
other O
port O
rights O
then O
their O
reference O
counts O
won O
t O
be O
decremented O
. O

If O
we O
can O
find O
a O
MIG O
method O
which O
returns O
KERN_SUCCESS O
but O
doesn O
t O
in O
fact O
take O
ownership O
of O
any O
mach O
ports O
its O
passed O
( O
by O
for O
example O
storing O
them O
and O
dropping O
the O
ref O
later O
, O
or O
using O
them O
then O
immediately O
dropping O
the O
ref O
or O
passing O
them O
to O
another O
method O
which O
takes O
ownership O
) O
then O
this O
can O
lead O
to O
us O
being O
able O
to O
leak O
references O
. O

This O
violates O
ipc_kobject_server O
ownership O
model O
where O
success O
means O
ownership O
was O
taken O
of O
all O
rights O
, O
not O
just O
some O
. O

When O
userspace O
sends O
a O
message O
the O
kernel O
will O
copy O
in O
the O
message O
body O
and O
also O
copy O
in O
all O
the O
message O
rights O
; O
see O
for O
example O
ipc_right_copyin O
in O
ipc_right.c O
. O

( O
sym O
= O
OSSymbol O
: O
:withCString O
( O
notification_type O
) O
) O
) O
err O
= O
kIOReturnNoResources O
; O
if O
( O
matching_size O
) O
{ O
dict O
= O
OSDynamicCast O
( O
OSDictionary O
, O
OSUnserializeXML O
( O
matching O
, O
matching_size O
) O
) O
; O
} O
else O
{ O
dict O
= O
OSDynamicCast O
( O
OSDictionary O
, O
OSUnserializeXML O
( O
matching O
) O
) O
; O
} O
if O
( O
! O
dict O
) O
{ O
err O
= O
kIOReturnBadArgument O
; O
continue O
while O
( O
false O
) O
; O
return O
( O
err O
) O
; O
This O
inner O
function O
has O
many O
failure O
cases O
( O
wrong O
kernel O
port O
, O
invalid O
serialized O
data O
) O
which O
we O
can O

trigger O
and O
these O
error O
paths O
lead O
to O
this O
inner O
function O
not O
taking O
ownership O
of O
the O
wake_port O
argument O
. O

MIG O
and O
mach O
message O
rights O
ownership O
ipc_kobject_server O
in O

is O
the O
main O

for O

MIG O

. O

request- O
> O
ikm_header- O
> O
msgh_local_port O
= O
MACH_PORT_NULL O
; O
ipc_kmsg_destroy O
( O
request O
) O
; O
} O
If O
the O
MIG O
callout O
returns O
success O
, O
then O
it O
means O
that O
the O
method O
took O
ownership O
of O
all O
of O
the O
rights O
contained O
in O
the O
message O
. O

However O
, O
MIG O
will O
only O
see O
the O
return O
value O
of O
the O
outer O
internal_io_service_add_notification_ool O
which O
will O
always O
return O
success O
if O
we O
pass O
a O
valid O
ool O
memory O
descriptor O
. O

If O
we O
send O
this O
request O
0xffffffff O
times O
we O
can O
cause O
a O
ipc_port_t O
io_references O
field O
to O
overflow O
to O
0 O
; O
the O
next O
time O
it O
used O
the O
ref O
will O
go O
0 O
- O
1 O
- O
0 O
and O
the O
object O
will O
be O
free O
d O
but O
we O
ll O
still O
have O
a O
dangling O
pointer O
in O
our O
process O
ports O
table O
. O

Destroy O
everthing O
except O
the O
reply O
port O
right O
, O
which O
is O
needed O
in O
the O
reply O
message O
. O

ipc_kmsg_free O
( O
request O
) O
; O
} O
else O
{ O
The O
message O
contents O
of O
the O
request O
are O
intact O
. O

This O
means O
that O
by O
the O
time O
we O
reach O
the O
actual O
callout O
to O
the O
MIG O
handler O
any O
port O
rights O
contained O
in O
a O
request O
have O
had O
their O
reference O
count O
increased O
by O
one O
. O

If O
the O
MIG O
callout O
returns O
a O
failure O
code O
then O
the O
means O
the O
method O
took O
ownership O
of O
none O
of O
the O
rights O
contained O
in O
the O
message O
. O

ipc_kmsg_destroy O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
will O
decrement O
the O
reference O
counts O
for O
all O
the O
port O
rights O
in O
the O
message O
, O
even O
those O
in O
port O
descriptors O
. O

If O
we O
call O
io_service_add_notification_ool O
with O
a O
valid O
ool O
descriptor O
, O
but O
fill O

with O

but O

will O

, O
not O
ipc_kmsg_destroy O
. O

As O
well O
as O
being O
a O
regular O
kernel O
UaF O
this O
also O
gives O
us O
the O
opportunity O
to O
do O
all O

of O
fun O
mach O
port O

send O
rights O
to O
other O
task O
task O
ports O
via O
our O
dangling O

pointer O
. O

What O
this O
leads O
to O
is O
actually O
quite O
a O
nice O
primitive O
for O
constructing O
an O
ipc_port_t O
reference O
count O
overflow O
without O
leaking O
any O

. O

After O

code O
( O
still O
in O

) O
: O
if O
( O
( O
kr O
KERN_SUCCESS O
) O
|| O
( O
kr O

The O
server O
function O
is O
responsible O
for O
the O
contents O
of O
the O
message O
. O

Unlike O

, O

will O

interesting O
. O

Proof O
of O
Concept O
: O

The O
reply O
port O
right O
is O
moved O
to O
the O
reply O
message O
, O
and O

have O

. O

Source O
: O
ports O
are O
really O
struct O
ipc_port_t O
in O
the O
kernel O
; O
this O
is O
a O
reference-counted O
object O
, O
ip_reference O
and O
ip_release O
atomically O
increment O
and O
decrement O
the O
32 O
bit O
io_references O
field O
. O

Note O
that O
there O
are O
no O
resources O
leaks O
involved O
here O
so O

can O
run O
it O
even O
on O
very O

systems O
like O

and O

will O
work O
fine O
, O
albeit O
a O
bit O
slowly O
: O
) O
This O
code O
is O
reachable O
from O
all O
sandboxed O
environments O
. O

indirect O
MIG O
methods O

Integer O
Overflow O
Vulnerability O
. O

The O
apache-auth.conf O
, O
apache-nohome.conf O
, O
apache-noscript.conf O
, O
and O
apache-overflows.conf O
files O
in O
Fail2ban SN
before SV
0.8.10 SV
do O
not O
properly O
validate O
log O
messages O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
block O
arbitrary O
IP O
addresses O
via O
certain O
messages O
in O
a O
request O
. O

Address O
listed O
on O
Fail2ban O
whitelist O
are O
not O
affected O
. O

More O
information O
, O
including O
proof O
of O
concept O
and O
patches O
is O
available O
here O
: O
Thanks O
in O
advance O
, O
Please O
use O
CVE-2013-2178 O
for O
this O
issue O
. O

Malicious O
user O
can O
easily O
inject O
his O
own O
data O
to O
analyzed O
logs O
and O
deceive O
monitoring O
engine O
. O

files O
: O
/filter.d/apache-auth.conf O
/filter.d/apache-nohome.conf O

/filter.d/apache-overflows.conf O

frames O
: O

- O

vulnerability O

released O
to O

. O

vulnerability O
exists O
in O

and O

is O

by O

of O

. O

ESA-2011-022 O
: O
EMC O
Documentum O
eRoom O
Indexing O
Server O
HummingBird O
Client O
Connector O
Buffer O
Overflow O
Vulnerability O

When O
parsing O
a O
particular O
packet O
received O
from O
a O
TCP O
connection O
, O
the O
application O
will O
attempt O
to O
copy O
part O
of O
the O
packet O
contents O
into O
a O
buffer O
located O
on O
the O
stack O
. O

Explicit O
details O
regarding O
the O
specifics O
of O
the O
vulnerability O
are O
not O
exposed O
to O
any O
parties O
until O

official O

is O

available O
. O

TippingPoint O
does O
not O

or O

code O
. O

ZDI-09-014 O
: O
Adobe O
Acrobat O
getIcon O
( O
) O
Stack O
Overflow O
Vulnerability O

Buffer O
overflow O
in O
klim5.sys O
in O
Kaspersky SN
Anti-Virus SN
for O
Workstations O
6.0 SV
and O
Anti-Virus SN
2008 SV
allows O
local O
users O
to O
gain O
privileges O
via O
an O
IOCTL O
0x80052110 O
call O
. O

NDIS O
calls O
are O
context-free O
by O
definition O
, O
so O
when O
a O
packet O
arrives O
or O
is O
sent O
, O
the O
NDIS O
call O
can O
be O
invoked O
in O
an O
arbitrary O
thread O
context O
. O

.text:00011774 O
cmp O
ecx O
, O
80052110h O
; O

, O

; O

] O
, O

short O

This O

exploit O
modifies O
the O
callback O
to O
point O
to O
the O
address O
of O
its O

the O
steps O

+ O

our O

process/thread O
+ O

common O
bytes O
in O

. O

Non-technical O
description O
Klim5.sys O
is O

a O

to O

. O

in O

A O

There O
is O

buffer O
overflow O
in O

function O
of O

in O

0.49.4 SV
. O

The O
malloc O
implementation O
in O
the O
GNU SN
C SN
Library SN
( O
aka SN
glibc SN
or SN
libc6 SN
) O
, O
from SV
version SV
2.24 SV
to SV
2.26 SV
on O

, O
and O
only O
in O

2.26 SV

did O
not O
properly O
handle O

with O
arguments O

to O

could O
return O

that O
is O

, O

to O

corruption O
. O

In O

, O
a O

leak O
was O
found O
in O

. O

The O
UNIX O

layer O
in O

, O

prior SV
to SV

in O

. O

This O

does O
not O

products O
. O

in O

before SV

. O

: O

The O
camera O
driver O
does O
not O
validate O
the O
external O
input O
parameters O
and O
causes O
an O
integer O
overflow O
, O
which O
in O

in O

overflow O
. O

Huawei SN
Mate SN
9 SV
Pro SV
smartphones O
with O
software O
LON-AL00BC00B139D O
; O
LON-AL00BC00B229 O
have O
an O
integer O
overflow O
vulnerability O
. O

An O
attacker O
tricks O
the O
user O
to O
install O
a O
crafted O
application O
, O
successful O
exploit O
could O
cause O
malicious O
code O
execution O
. O

elf.c O
in O
the O
Binary O
File O
Descriptor O
( O
BFD O
) O
library O
( O
aka O
libbfd O
) O
, O
as O
distributed O
in O
GNU SN
Binutils SN
2.29.1 SV
, O
does O
not O
validate O
sizes O
of O
core O
notes O
, O
which O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
bfd_getl32 O
heap-based O
buffer O
over-read O
and O
application O
crash O
) O
via O
a O
crafted O
object O
file O
, O
related O
to O
elfcore_grok_netbsd_procinfo O
, O
elfcore_grok_openbsd_procinfo O
, O
and O
elfcore_grok_nto_status O
. O

This O
will O
lead O
to O
a O
potential O
exploit O
using O
carefully O
crafted O
invalid O
values O
. O

An O
issue O
was O
discovered O
in O
Teluu O
pjproject O
( O
pjlib O
and O
pjlib-util O
) O
in O
PJSIP SN
before SV
2.7.1 SV
. O

all O
had O
the O
potential O
to O
overflow O
, O
either O
causing O
unintended O
values O
to O
be O
captured O
or O
, O
if O
the O
values O
were O
subsequently O
converted O
back O
to O
strings O
, O

The O

are O
due O
to O
a O
buffer O
overflow O
condition O
in O
the O
SNMP O
subsystem O
of O
the O
affected O
software O
. O

All O

that O
have O

and O

affected O

or O

. O

via O
SNMP SN
Version O
3 SV
, O

attacker O
must O
have O
user O
credentials O
for O
the O
affected O
system O
. O

The O
Simple O
Network O
Management O
Protocol O
( O
SNMP O
) O
subsystem O
of O
Cisco SN
IOS SN
12.0 SV
through SV
12.4 SV
and SV
15.0 SV
through SV

and O
IOS SN

2.2 SV
through SV
3.17 SV
contains O
multiple O

that O
could O
allow O
an O
authenticated O
, O
remote O

to O

execute O
code O

an O
affected O
system O
or O
cause O
an O
affected O
system O
to O
reload O
. O

To O
exploit O
these O
vulnerabilities O
via O
SNMP SN
Version O
2c SV
or SV

the O
attacker O
must O
know O

SNMP O

community O
string O
for O
the O
affected O
system O
. O

The O

affect O
all O
versions O
of O
SNMP SN
: O

1 SV
, O
2c SV
, O
and SV
3 SV
. O

An O

could O
exploit O
these O
vulnerabilities O
by O
sending O
a O

packet O
to O
an O
affected O
system O
via O

or O

. O

Cisco O
Bug O
IDs O
: O
CSCve66658 O
. O

Only O
traffic O
directed O
to O

affected O
system O
can O
be O
used O
to O

these O
vulnerabilities O
. O

in O

function O
in O

in O

before SV

: O

in O

issue O

message O
. O

buffer O
overflow O
in O

function O
in O

renderer O
in O

Subject O
: O
CVE O
request O
: O
Stack O
overflow O
in O
redcarpet O
header_anchor O
After O
examining O
the O
redcarpet O
source O
code O
, O
I O
noticed O
that O
header_anchor O
uses O
variable O
length O
arrays O
( O
VLA O
) O
without O
any O
range O
checking O
. O

Title O
: O
Stack O
overflow O
in O
redcarpet O
header_anchor O
Products O
: O
redcarpet O

This O
is O
conducive O
to O
a O
stack O
overflow O
, O
followed O
by O
the O
potential O
for O
arbitrary O
code O
execution O
. O

Redcarpet O
is O
a O
Markdown O
parser O
library O
. O

Affects O
: O
v3.3.0 SV
- SV
v3.3.1 SV

overflow O

request O

Exploit O
Title O
: O
antMan SN
< SV
= SV
0.9.0c SV
Authentication O
Bypass O
Date O
: O
02-27-2018 O
Software O
Link O
: O
Version O
: O
< SV
= SV
0.9.0c SV

To O

use O
a O

to O

and O

as O

: O
POST O
/login O

: O

[ O

] O

& O
password= O
% O
0a O
You O
will O

to O

as O

user O
. O

not O

by O

. O

Proof O
of O
Concept O

antMan O
authentication O
implementation O
obtains O
user-supplied O
username O
and O
password O
parameters O
from O
a O
POST O
request O
issued O
to O

. O

Solution O
: O
Update O
to O
version O
0.9.1a O

Description O

versions O
< SV
= SV
0.9.c SV
contain O
a O
critical O

defect O
, O
allowing O
an O
unauthenticated O

allow O

bypass O
the O
authentication O
checks O
. O

SplitClearSignedFile O
( O
) O

First O
, O
prepare O
a O
clean O
Debian O
VM O
for O
the O
victim O
: O
- O
download O

( O

- O

) O
- O
create O

- O

) O

in O

some O

machine O
instead O
of O
the O
proper O
mirror O
( O
deb O
jessie-updates O
main O
or O
so O
) O
. O

You O
might O
want O
to O
consider O
whether O
you O
could O
harden O
this O
code O
that O
way O
. O

Because O
ASLR O
randomizes O
the O
address O
space O
after O
each O
execve O
( O
) O
, O
thereby O
altering O
how O
much O
contiguous O
virtual O
memory O
is O
available O
, O
an O
allocation O
that O
attempts O
to O
use O
the O
average O
available O
virtual O
memory O
should O
ideally O
succeed O
50 O
% O
of O
the O
time O
, O
resulting O
in O
an O
upper O
limit O
of O
25 O
% O
for O
the O
success O
rate O
of O
the O
whole O
attack O
. O

It O
first O
looks O
as O
if O
it O
would O
be O
impossible O
to O
create O
a O
file O
that O
is O
recognized O
as O
split-signed O
by O
ExecGPGV O
( O
) O
, O
but O
isn O
t O
recognized O
by O

( O
) O
, O
because O
both O
use O
the O
same O
function O
, O
SplitClearSignedFile O
( O
) O
, O
for O
parsing O
the O
file O
. O

[ O

] O

... O

Therefore O
, O
if O
an O
attacker O
can O
cause O
the O
address O
space O
in O

main O

process O
to O
be O
sufficiently O
constrained O
to O
prevent O
allocation O
of O
a O
large O

buffer O
while O
the O
address O
space O
of O

gpgv O
helper O
process O
is O

and O
permits O
the O

of O

buffer O
with O
the O
same O
size O
, O
the O
attacker O
can O
use O

to O
fake O
an O

condition O
in O
SplitClearSignedFile O
( O
) O
that O
causes O
the O
file O
to O
be O
parsed O
as O
a O
normal O
Release O
file O
. O

The O
weakness O
here O
is O
: O
If O
an O
attacker O
can O
create O
an O

file O
that O
is O
parsed O
as O
a O
proper O
split-signed O
file O
during O
signature O

, O
but O
then O
isn O
t O
recognized O
by O

( O
) O
, O
the O
leading O
garbage O
that O
was O
ignored O
by O
the O
signature O
validation O
is O
interpreted O
as O
repository O
metadata O
, O
bypassing O
the O
signing O
scheme O
. O

This O
would O
get O
rid O
of O
the O
weakness O
that O
the O
file O
is O
parsed O
twice O
and O
parsing O
differences O
can O
have O
security O
consequences O
, O
which O
is O
a O
pretty O
brittle O
design O
. O

After O
this O
operation O
, O
109 O
kB O
disk O
space O
will O
be O
freed O
. O

Done O
root O
@ O
debian O
: O
/home/user O
apt-get O
upgrade O
Reading O
package O
lists O
... O

It O
will O
probably O
fail O
- O
run O
it O
again O
until O
it O
doesn O
t O
fail O
anymore O
. O

A O
return O
code O
of O
-1 O
, O
which O
signals O
that O
either O
EOF O
or O
an O
error O
occured O
, O
is O
always O
treated O
as O
EOF O
. O

I O
think O
that O
it O
would O
make O
sense O
to O
fix O
this O
as O
follows O
: O
- O
Set O
errno O
to O
0 O
before O
calling O
getline O
( O
) O
, O
verify O
that O
it O
still O
0 O
after O
returning O
-1 O
, O
treat O
it O
as O
an O
error O
if O
errno O
isn O
t O
0 O
anymore O
. O

At O
this O
point O
, O
the O
code O
isn O
t O
aware O
anymore O
whether O
the O
Release O
file O
was O
clearsigned O
or O
split-signed O
, O
so O
the O
file O
is O
opened O
using O
OpenMaybeClearSignedFile O
( O
) O
, O
which O
first O
attempts O
to O
parse O
the O
file O
as O
a O

( O

) O

and O

, O

falls O
back O
to O
treating O
the O
file O
as O
the O
file O
as O
a O
split-signed O
( O
Release O
) O
file O
if O
the O
file O
format O
couldn O
t O
be O
recognized O
. O

Do O
you O
want O
to O
continue O

This O
simulates O
a O
MITM O
attack O
or O
compromised O
mirror O
. O

Afterwards O

again O

. O

This O

of O

is O
designed O
. O

update O
has O

. O

... O

: O

( O
) O

. O

( O
) O

Source O
: O
Vulnerability O

- O

Subject O
: O

CVE-2016-0772 O
: O

, O

is O
to O

: O

GZIP O
files O
can O
contain O
multiple O
compressed O
streams O
, O
which O
are O
assembled O
when O
the O
contents O
are O
extracted O
. O

If O
the O
length O
field O
in O
the O
header O
of O
a O
file O
with O
test O
EICAR O
virus O
included O
into O
a O
TAR O
archive O
is O
set O
to O
be O
greater O
than O
the O
archive O
total O
length O
( O
1,000,000+original O
length O
in O
our O
experiments O
) O
, O
the O
antivirus O
declares O
the O
file O
to O
be O
clean O
but O
virus O
gets O
extracted O
correctly O
by O
the O
GNU O
tar O
program O
. O

a O
TAR O
archive O
contains O
two O
files O
: O

first O

clean O

modified O
such O
that O
the O
length O
field O
in O
the O
header O
of O
the O
first O
, O

file O
to O
point O
into O
the O
middle O
of O
the O
header O
of O
the O
second O
, O
infected O
file O
. O

Evasion O
attacks O
expoliting O
file-parsing O
vulnerabilities O
in O
antivirus O
products O

The O
FakeFile O
implementation O
in O
the O
sandbox O
environment O
in O
the O
Google SN
App SN
Engine SN
Python SN
SDK SN
before SV
1.5.4 SV
does O
not O
properly O
control O
the O
opening O
of O
files O
, O
which O
allows O
local O
users O
to O
bypass O
intended O
access O
restrictions O
and O
create O
arbitrary O
files O
via O
ALLOWED_MODES O
and O
ALLOWED_DIRS O
changes O
within O
the O
code O
parameter O
to O
_ah/admin/interactive/execute O
, O
a O
different O
vulnerability O
than O
CVE-2011-1364 O
. O

The O
add_del_listener O
function O
in O
kernel/taskstats.c O
i O
n O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
2.6.39.1 SV
and SV
earlier SV
does O
not O
prevent O
multiple O
registrations O
of O
exit O
handlers O
, O
which O
allows O
local O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
and O
CPU O
consumption O
) O
, O
and O
bypass O
the O
OOM O
Killer O
, O
via O
a O
crafted O
application O
. O

It O
makes O
it O
possible O
for O
unprivileged O
user O
eat O
kernel O
memory O
and O
CPU O
without O
triggering O
OOM O
killer O
. O

It O
may O
lead O
to O
a O
bloated O
listeners O
chain O
and O
very O
slow O
process O
terminations O
. O

after O
10KK O
sent O
TASKSTATS_CMD_ATTR_REGISTER_CPUMASKs O
~300 O
Mb O
of O
kernel O
memory O
is O
stolen O
for O
the O
handlers O
chain O
and O
time O
id O
shows O
2-7 O
seconds O
instead O
of O
normal O
0.003 O
. O

Was O
introduced O
in O
f9fd8914c1acca0d98b69d831b128d5b52f03c51 O
. O

Thanks O
, O
Vasiliy O
Kulikov O
- O
bringing O
security O
into O
open O
computing O
environments O

It O
makes O
it O
possible O
to O
exhaust O
all O
kernel O
memory O
and O
to O
eat O
much O
of O
CPU O
time O
by O
triggerring O
numerous O
exits O
on O
a O
single O
CPU O
. O

The O
patch O
limits O
the O
number O
of O
times O
a O
single O
process O
may O
register O
itself O
on O
a O
single O
CPU O
to O
one O
. O

. O

Description O
- O

bug O
in O

validation O

used O
to O

to O

to O

to O

of O

share O

. O

: O
SHA1 O
ERRATA O
- O
The O
original O

for O
the O
Samba O
vulnerability O
identified O
by O

reported O
that O

. O

The O
Samba O
Team O
BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNATURE O
Version O
: O
GnuPG O
v1.2.4 O
( O
GNU/Linux O
) O

Such O
files O
must O
still O
be O
readable O
by O
the O
account O
used O
for O
the O
connection O
. O

Later O

has O
confirmed O
that O
only O
Samba SN
3.0.x SV
< SV
= SV
3.0.2a SV
contains O
the O
exploitable O
code O
. O

However O
, O
under O
certain O

may O
not O

to O
immediately O
upgrade O
important O
installations O
. O

which O

outside O

The O
vulnerability O
allows O
an O

to O
bypass O

and O

of O

. O

The O

to O

. O

Security O

discovered O
an O

bypass O
vulnerability O
in O
version O
2.0.2 SV
of O
the O
Conserus SN

Intelligence SN
by O
McKesson O
Medical O

Company O

which O
is O
now O
a O
Change O

company O
. O

An O

can O

to O
other O

. O

can O

and O
be O

access O
reserved O
for O
higher O

users O
. O

: O

WebKit/Source/core/css/StyleSheetContents.cpp O
in O

, O
as O
used O
in O
Google SN
Chrome SN
before SV

permits O

of O

by O
a O

type O

which O
allows O

to O
bypass O
the O

Policy O
via O
a O
crafted O
web O
site O
. O

Cybozu SN

3.x SV
and SV
4.x SV
before SV
4.2.1 SV
allows O
remote O
authenticated O
users O
to O
bypass O
intended O
access O
restrictions O
and O
obtain O
sensitive O
Address O
Book O
information O
via O
an O

call O
, O
a O
different O
vulnerability O
than O

. O

The O
server O
implementation O
of O
the O

protocol O
in O
the O

in O
strongSwan SN
4.2.12 SV
through SV

before SV

does O
not O
properly O
validate O
local O
state O
, O

to O

message O
in O

to O

packets O
in O

in O

before SV
4.2.8p4 SV
, O
and SV

remote O

to O
bypass O
authentication O
. O

The O
http_basic_authenticate_with O
method O
in O
actionpack/lib/action_controller/metal/http_authentication.rb O
in O
the O
Basic O
Authentication O
implementation O
in O
Action O
Controller O
in O
Ruby SN
on SN
Rails SN
before SV
3.2.22.1 SV
, O
4.0.x SV
and SV
4.1.x SV
before SV
4.1.14.1 SV
, O
4.2.x SV
before SV
4.2.5.1 SV
, O
and SV
5.x SV
before SV
5.0.0.beta1.1 SV
does O
not O
use O
a O
constant-time O
algorithm O
for O
verifying O
credentials O
, O
which O
makes O
it O
easier O
for O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
authentication O
by O
measuring O
timing O
differences O
. O

Subject O
: O
[ O
CVE-2015-7576 O
] O
Timing O
attack O
vulnerability O
in O
basic O
authentication O
in O
Action O
Controller O
. O

Fixed O
Versions O
: O
5.0.0.beta1.1 O
, O
4.2.5.1 O
, O
4.1.14.1 O
, O
3.2.22.1 O
Impact O
Due O
to O
the O
way O
that O
Action O
Controller O
compares O
user O
names O
and O
passwords O
in O
basic O
authentication O
authorization O
code O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
for O
an O
attacker O
to O
analyze O
the O
time O
taken O
by O
a O
response O
and O
intuit O
the O
password O
. O

You O
can O
tell O
you O
application O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
this O
attack O
by O
looking O
for O
`http_basic_authenticate_with` O
method O
calls O
in O
your O
application O
. O

Workarounds O
If O
you O
can O
t O
upgrade O
, O
please O
use O
the O
following O
monkey O
patch O
in O
an O
initializer O
that O
is O
loaded O
before O
your O
application O
cat O
config/initializers/basic_auth_fix.rb O
module O
ActiveSupport O
module O
SecurityUtils O
def O
secure_compare O
( O
a O
, O
b O
) O
return O
false O
unless O
a.bytesize O
b.bytesize O
l O
= O
a.unpack O
C O
{ O
a.bytesize O
} O
res O
= O
0 O
b.each_byte O
{ O
|byte| O
res O
|= O
byte O
^ O
l.shift O
} O
res O
0 O
end O
module_function O
: O
secure_compare O
def O
variable_size_secure_compare O
( O
a O
, O
b O
) O
secure_compare O
( O
: O
:Digest O
: O
:SHA256.hexdigest O
( O
a O
) O
, O
: O
:Digest O
: O
:SHA256.hexdigest O
( O
b O
) O
) O
end O
module_function O
: O
variable_size_secure_compare O
end O
end O
module O
ActionController O
class O
Base O
def O
self.http_basic_authenticate_with O
( O
options O
before_action O
( O
options.except O
( O
: O
name O
, O
: O
password O
, O
: O
realm O
) O
) O
do O
authenticate_or_request_with_http_basic O
( O
options O
[ O
: O
realm O
] O
|| O
Application O
) O
do O
|name O
, O
password| O
This O
comparison O
uses O
& O
so O
that O
it O
doesn O
t O
short O
circuit O
and O
uses O
`variable_size_secure_compare` O
so O
that O
length O
information O
isn O
t O
leaked O
. O

For O
example O
, O
this O
string O
comparison O
: O
foo O
bar O
is O
possibly O
faster O
than O
this O
comparison O
: O
foo O
fo1 O
Attackers O
can O
use O
this O
information O
to O
attempt O
to O
guess O
the O
username O
and O
password O
used O
in O
the O
basic O
authentication O
system O
. O

Not O
affected O
: O
None O
. O

ActiveSupport O
: O
:SecurityUtils.variable_size_secure_compare O
( O
name O
, O
options O
[ O
: O
name O
] O
) O
& O
ActiveSupport O
: O
:SecurityUtils.variable_size_secure_compare O
( O
password O
, O
options O
[ O
: O
password O
] O
) O
end O
end O
end O
end O
end O
`` O
` O
Patches O

aid O
users O
who O
aren O
t O

to O
upgrade O
immediately O
we O
have O
provided O
patches O
for O
the O

supported O
release O
series O
. O

- O
Patch O
for O
4.1 O
series O
4-2-basic_auth.patch O
- O
Patch O
for O
4.2 O
series O
5-0-basic_auth.patch O
- O
Patch O
for O
5.0 O
series O
Please O
note O
that O
only O
the O
4.1.x O
and O
4.2.x O
series O
are O
supported O
at O
present O
. O

They O
are O
in O
git-am O
format O
and O
consist O
of O
a O
single O
changeset O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
has O
been O
assigned O
the O
CVE O
identifier O
CVE-2015-7576 O
. O

All O
users O
running O
an O
affected O
release O
should O
either O

immediately O
. O

: O

attack O

MediaWiki SN
before SV
1.19.24 SV
, O
1.2x SV
before SV
1.23.9 SV
, O
and SV
1.24.x SV
before SV
1.24.2 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
bypass O
the O
SVG O
filtering O
and O
obtain O
sensitive O
user O
information O
via O
a O
mixed O
case O
@ O
import O
in O
a O
style O
element O
in O
an O
SVG O
file O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
by O
@ O
imporT O
. O

< O
MediaWiki O
user O
Bawolff O
pointed O
out O
that O
the O
SVG O
filter O
to O
prevent O
injecting O
JavaScript O
using O
animate O
elements O
was O
incorrect O
. O

< O
iSEC O
Partners O
discovered O
that O
MediaWiki O
SVG O
and O
XMP O
parsing O
running O
under O
HHVM O
was O
susceptible O
to O
Billion O
Laughs O
DoS O
attacks O
( O
iSEC-WMF1214-13 O
) O
. O

MIME O
types O
are O
now O
whitelisted O
. O

< O
Internal O
review O
and O
iSEC O
Partners O
discovered O
( O
iSEC-WMF1214-1 O
) O
that O
MediaWiki O
versions O
using O
PBKDF2 O
for O
password O
hashing O
( O
the O
default O
since O
1.24 O
) O
are O
vulnerable O
to O
DoS O
attacks O
using O
extremely O
long O
passwords O
. O

< O
Extension O
: O
CheckUser O
- O
iSEC O
Partners O
discovered O
that O
the O
CheckUser O
extension O
did O
not O
prevent O
CSRF O
attacks O
on O
the O
form O
allowing O
checkusers O
to O
look O
up O
sensitive O
information O
about O
other O
users O
( O
iSEC-WMF1214-6 O
) O
. O

For O
MediaWiki O
, O
we O
say O
that O
HHVM O
support O
is O
experimental O
, O
although O

Hi O
, O

patched O
several O

issues O
in O

< O
Extension O
: O
Scribunto O
- O
MediaWiki O
user O
Jackmcbarn O
discovered O
that O
function O
names O
were O
sanitized O
in O
Lua O
error O
backtraces O
, O
which O
could O

to O
XSS O
. O

MediaWiki O
now O
detects O
and O
mitigates O
this O
issue O
on O
older O

of O
HHVM O
. O

iSEC O
Partners O
discovered O
a O
way O
to O
circumvent O
the O
SVG O
MIME O
blacklist O
for O
embedded O
resources O
( O
iSEC-WMF1214-11 O
) O
. O

Since O
the O
use O
of O
CheckUser O
is O
logged O
, O

CSRF O
could O
be O
abused O
to O
defame O
a O

the O
logs O
with O
noise O
. O

by O
Mario O
Gomes O

. O

This O
feature O
has O
been O
removed O
. O

< O

review O
found O
that O
MediaWiki O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
Quadratic O
Blowup O
DoS O
attacks O
, O
under O
both O
HHVM O
and O
Zend O
PHP O
. O

< O
These O
next O
issues O
came O
up O
because O
of O
the O
difference O
in O
how O
HHVM O
handles O
PHP O
code O
vs O
Zend O
. O

This O
is O

and O
isn O

CVE-2015-2942 O
exponential O

( O

) O

Use O
CVE-2015-2941 O
for O
this O
MediaWiki O
vulnerability O
in O
which O
unsafe O
calls O
to O
wddx_serialize_value O
can O
occur O
. O

For O
many O
products O
, O
the O
implied O
security O
policy O
does O
not O
include O
a O
CSRF O
protection O
mechanism O
that O
prevents O
all O
undesirable/confusing O
log O
entries O
. O

It O
seems O
that O
the O
major O
concern O
here O
is O
the O
HHVM O
vulnerability O
fixed O
by O
the O
commit O
. O

Also O
, O
in O
some O
cases O
, O

support O
is O
referenced O
or O
documented O
in O
places O
that O
don O

on O
the O
and O
pages O
. O

does O
not O
mean O
that O
similar O
reports O
from O
arbitrary O

about O

. O

Name O
: O
Muster O

: O
Muster SN
< SV
6.20 SV
Researcher O
: O
Nick O
Freeman O
( O
nick.freeman O
@ O
security-assessment.com O
) O
Description O
Security-Assessment.com O
has O
discovered O
a O
vulnerability O
with O
the O
Muster SN
6.1.6 SV
web O
management O
server O
. O

By O
using O
directory O
traversal O
characters O
in O
the O
URL O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
specify O
any O
file O
on O
the O
file O
system O
to O
be O
served O
to O
the O
client O
. O

Solution O
A O
patch O
is O
available O
from O
the O
vendor O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99s O
website O
. O

Version O
6.20 SV
remediates O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Exploitation O
of O
this O
vulnerability O
does O
not O
require O
authentication O
. O

Exploitation O
It O
is O
possible O
to O
download O
any O
file O
on O
the O
Muster O
server O
by O
exploiting O
a O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
web O
server O
. O

By O
retrieving O
this O
database O
or O
other O
similar O
configuration O
files O
, O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
gain O
administrative O
access O
over O
the O
render O
farm O
. O

in O

The O
following O

to O

. O

. O

Because O
the O
built-in O
FTP O
server O
provides O
full O
access O
to O
the O
IFS O
, O
a O
valid O
, O
authenticated O
user O
, O
can O
access O
and O
retrieve O
via O
FTP O
all O
of O
the O
database O

and O
all O
of O
the O
files O
that O
he O
has O
authority O
to O
access O
, O
based O
on O
the O
server O
assigned O
object O
authority O
. O

Several O
iSeries O
security O
products O
have O
been O
found O
to O
be O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
canonicalization O
attack O
resulting O
in O
a O

to O
iSeries O
database O

that O
were O
supposedly O

This O

usually O
addressed O
by O
third O
party O
iSeries O
security O
products O
that O
attempt O
to O
limit O

to O

. O

Canonicalization O
problems O
in O
iSeries O
FTP O
security O
products O
Overview O
The O
IBM O
iSeries O
( O
AS/400 O
) O
server O
provides O
a O
unified O
access O
scheme O
, O
called O
IFS O
, O
to O
all O
of O
the O
files O
and O
to O

database O

. O

March O

received O
. O

Full O

vulnerability O

iSeries O

without O
FTP O

protection O
are O

by O
default O
. O

For O

. O

request O
namespace O
. O

was O

About O

, O
the O

center O

, O

for O

The O
company O

product O
, O
CORE O
IMPACT O
, O
is O
the O
most O
comprehensive O
product O
for O
performing O
enterprise O
security O
assurance O
testing O
. O

Our O
results O
include O
problem O
formalization O
, O
identification O
of O
vulnerabilities O
, O
novel O

and O

for O

Of O
Concept O
Code O
The O
Landesk O
web O
application O
does O
not O
sufficiently O
verify O
if O
a O
well-formed O
request O
was O
provided O
by O
the O
user O
who O
submitted O
the O
request O
. O

Using O
this O
information O
an O
external O
remote O
attacker O
can O
run O
arbitrary O
code O
using O
the O
gsbadmin O
user O
( O
that O
is O
the O
user O
running O
the O
web-server O
) O
, O
but O
the O
gsbadmin O
user O
has O
sudo O
privileges O
. O

We O
conduct O
our O
research O
in O
several O
important O
areas O
of O
computer O
security O
including O
system O
vulnerabilities O
, O
cyber O
attack O
planning O
and O
simulation O
, O
source O
code O
auditing O
, O
and O
cryptography O
. O

It O
enables O
organizations O
to O
determine O
if O
current O
security O
investments O
are O
detecting O
and O
preventing O
attacks O
. O

CORE O
IMPACT O
evaluates O
network O
, O
endpoint O
and O
end-user O
vulnerabilities O
and O
identifies O
what O
resources O
are O
exposed O
. O

security O
vulnerability O
was O
discovered O
in O

Management O
Suite O
: O

web O
application O
does O
not O

verify O
if O

by O

who O

. O

The O

contains O
the O
actual O
injection O
. O

Ruby SN
on SN

2.1 SV
before SV
2.1.3 SV
and SV

before SV

does O
not O
verify O

for O

for O

of O

. O

Use O
web O
management O
in O
isolation O
. O

The O
server O
sees O
the O
cookie O
and O
processes O
the O
request O
as O

end O
user O

for O

in O

IS O
condition O
. O

The O
server O
checks O

of O
this O
cookie O
on O
all O

actions O
. O

These O

. O

: O

. O

Vendor O
Status O
: O

September O

Contacted O

01 O
. O

All O
rights O

. O

It O
disallows O
request O
variables O
with O
the O
same O
name O
as O
PHP O
superglobal O
arrays O
. O

For O
each O
phase O

different O
attacks O
are O
possible O
. O

The O
following O
is O
an O
overview O
of O
the O
vulnerabilities O
within O
the O
3 O

. O

[ O
Unset O
variables O
] O
Unset O
( O
) O
is O
a O
dangerous O
function O
because O
older O
PHP O
versions O
( O
that O
are O
still O
installed O
on O
most O
servers O
) O
contained O
vulnerabilities O
that O
allowed O
bypassing O
it O
. O

Advisory O
07/2006 O
: O
phpMyAdmin O
Multiple O
CSRF O
Vulnerabilities O

Cross-site O
request O
forgery O
( O
CSRF O
) O
vulnerability O
in O
PHPX SN
3.0 SV
through SV
3.2.6 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
commands O
via O
URLs O
that O
are O
automatically O
executed O
on O
behalf O
of O
the O
administrator O
, O
as O
demonstrated O
using O
( O
1 O
) O
admin/page.php O
, O
( O
2 O
) O
admin/news.php O
, O
( O
3 O
) O
admin/user.php O
, O
( O
4 O
) O
admin/images.php O
, O
( O
5 O
) O
admin/page.php O
, O
or O
( O
6 O
) O
admin/forums.php O
. O

No O
more O
3 O
columns O
if O
you O
don O
t O
want O
it O
! O

Solution O
: O
The O
lead O
developer O
was O
first O
informed O
of O
these O
issues O
over O
a O
month O
ago O
. O

All O
of O
the O
issues O
should O
be O
addressed O
. O

It O
greatly O
impacts O
the O
security O
of O
a O
web O
application O
. O

You O
can O
create O
the O
page O
however O
you O
want O
, O
and O
PHPX O
will O
just O
insert O
code O
where O
you O
want O
it O
. O

Even O
using O
the O
POST O
method O
without O
an O
auth O
key O
or O
the O
like O
is O
a O
bad O
idea O
. O

Written O
in O
the O
powerful O
server O
language O
, O
PHP O
, O
and O
utilizing O
the O
amazingly O
fast O
and O
secure O
database O
MySQL O
, O
PHPX O
is O
a O
great O
solution O
for O
all O
size O
website O
communities O
, O
at O
the O
best O
price O
possible O
free O
! O

Upgrade O
is O
strongly O
advised O
. O

All O
in O
all O
I O
think O
they O
did O
a O
great O
job O
and O
take O
the O
security O
of O
their O
product O
very O
seriously O
: O
) O
phpX O
3.3.0 O
is O
to O
be O
released O
Monday O
, O
May O
the O
3rd O
. O

Vendor O
: O
PHPX O
URL O
: O
Version O
: O
PHPX O
3.26 O
& O
& O
Earlier O
Risk O
: O
Multiple O
Vulnerabilities O

Arbitrary O
Command O
Execution O
: O
This O
is O
really O
in O
my O
opinion O
at O
least O
, O
a O
very O
fundamental O
flaw O
. O

Description O
: O
PHPX O
is O
a O
constantly O
evolving O
and O
changing O
Content O
Management O
System O
( O
CMS O
) O
. O

PHPX O
provides O
content O
management O
combined O
with O
the O
power O
of O
a O
portal O
by O
including O
in O
the O
core O
package O
modules O
such O
as O
FAQ O
, O
polls O
, O
and O
forums O
. O

This O
is O
because O
$ O
limit O
isn O
t O
properly O
validated O
. O

It O
is O
a O
serious O
issue O
and O
should O
be O
treated O
as O
such O
. O

For O
example O
see O
below O
forums.php O
action=search O
& O
search_id= O
[ O
VID O
] O
& O
limit= O
This O
uri O
will O
result O
in O
a O
MySQL_fetch_row O
( O
) O
error O
and O
reveal O
the O
full O
physical O
path O
of O
the O
PHPX O
installation O
. O

Themes O
are O
included O
, O
but O
not O
required O
. O

If O
any O
one O
of O
these O
commands O
were O
placed O
in O
an O
image O
tag O
an O
attacker O
could O
delete O
users O
, O
news O
items O
, O
pages O
, O
images O
, O
polls O
, O
word O
censors O
, O
flags O
, O
xcode O
and O
probably O
more O
. O

Below O
are O
just O
a O
few O
examples O
. O

As O
stated O
in O
the O
HTTP/1.1 O
RFC O
( O
RFC O
2616 O
Section O
9.1.1 O
Safe O
Methods O
) O
no O
GET O
request O
should O
be O
used O
to O
make O
any O
significant O
actions O
. O

( O

Forgery O
) O

can O
result O

security O
context O
that O
is O

up O
using O
a O
malicious O

. O

in O

8 SV

. O

) O

, O

Disclosure O
, O

Of O

( O
a O
) O
Insider/Attacker O
can O

of O

and O

. O

Proof O
of O
Concept O
This O
exploit O
works O
only O
when O
accounts O
are O
using O
default O
password O
. O

This O
device O
has O
three O
default O
accounts O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98admin O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99 O
, O
xe2 O
x80 O

x80 O
x99 O
and O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98user O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99 O
. O

( O
b O
) O
This O
can O
ensure O
that O
no O
more O
patches O
are O
updated O
from O
OS O
vendor O
sites O
or O
firewall O
sites O
. O

Account O
name O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98user O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99 O
can O
just O
view O
configuration O
settings O
and O
statistics O
. O

All O
users O
of O
this O
hardware O
should O
change O
default O
passwords O
of O
all O
the O
default O
accounts O
. O

Author O
: O
B O
GOVIND O

Solution O
As O
per O
D-Link O
India O
this O
is O
the O
only O
no O
updated O
firmware O
available O
for O
this O
hardware O
version O
which O
can O
mitigate O
this O
vulnerability O
. O

Impact O
of O
vulnerability O
Information O
Disclosure O
: O
An O
attacker O
exploiting O
this O
vulnerability O
can O
obtain O
confidential O
information O
like O
users O
browsing O
profile O
. O

LAN O
side O
Firewall O
without O
admin O
privilege O
D-Link O
DSL-2730U O
wireless O
router O
is O
a O
very O
popular O
SOHO O
network O
device O
used O
in O
India O
. O

Here O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98inPassword O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99 O
is O
the O
new O
password O
and O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98inOrgPassword O
xe2 O
x80 O
x99 O
is O
the O
existing O
password O
. O

( O
c O
) O
Replace O
ads O
on O
legitimate O
sites O
and O
serve O
users O
with O
unwanted/fake O
ads O
. O

( O
d O
) O
Pushing O
malwares O
. O

This O
will O
result O
in O
attacker O
having O
complete O
control O
over O
the O
device O
. O

All O
users O
of O
this O
hardware O
should O
change O
default O
passwords O
of O
not O
just O
xe2 O
x80 O
x98admin O

x80 O
x99 O
account O

xe2 O

xe2 O
x80 O
x98admin O

x80 O

Privilege O
D-Link O
DSL-2730U O
wireless O
router O
is O
a O
very O
popular O
SOHO O
network O
device O
used O
in O
India O
. O

Attacker O
can O
deny O
services O
as O
per O
his/her O
choice O
. O

Default O
password O
of O

, O

and O
user O
account O

admin O
, O

user O

for O
confidentiality O
as O

between O

is O
using O
http O
. O

. O

He O

in O

in O
Bugzilla SN
3.x SV

Summary O
Bugzilla O
is O
a O
Web-based O
bug-tracking O
system O
used O
by O
a O
large O
number O
of O
software O
projects O

Technical O
Details O
Exploiting O
the O
vulnerability O
simply O
requires O
to O
: O
1 O
. O

a O
new O
password O
entry O
within O
Secret O
Server O
with O
the O
following O
value O
: O
Compass O

< O
script O
> O
alert O
( O
Compass O
Security O
) O

> O
2 O
. O

The O
identified O
vulnerability O
( O
stored O
Cross-Site O
Scripting O
) O
allows O
the O
execution O
of O
JavaScript O
code O
in O

of O
a O
valid O
user O
when O
it O
toggle O
the O
password O
mask O
on O
a O
specially O
crafted O
password O
. O

Vendor O
patch O
2015-06-24 O
Public O
disclosure O
References O
: O

Vulnerable O
: O
Secret O
Server O
customers O
on O
version O
8.6.000000 O
to O
8.8.000004 O
. O

Note O
that O
the O
payload O
defined O
in O
step O
1 O
did O
only O
get O
executed O
in O
the O
basic O
dashboard O
view O
. O

Milestones O
: O
2015-02-19 O
Vulnerability O
discovered O
2015-02-20 O
Vulnerability O
reported O
to O
vendor O
2015-02-20 O

This O
allows O
, O
for O
example O
, O
an O
attacker O
to O
prepare O
a O
specially O
crafted O
shared O
password O
, O

can O

all O
other O
passwords O
the O
victim O
has O
access O
to O
. O

Open O
the O
basic O
dashboard O
and O
toggle O
the O
password O
mask O
. O

The O
advanced O
dashboard O
did O
adequately O
encode O
the O
password O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
script O
included O
in O
step O
1 O
is O
executed O
. O

this O
issue O
. O

The O
second O
vulnerability O
is O
so-called O
open O
redirect O
vulnerability O
. O

This O
allows O
an O

to O

that O

to O

yet O

actually O
lands O
on O
the O

that O
the O
attacker O
controls O
. O

Hi O
, O
these O
Jenkins O
security O
issues O
don O
t O
seem O
to O
have O
CVEs O
assigned O
so O
far O
: O
I O
can O
t O
provide O
links O
to O
upstream O
fixes O
, O
but O
three O
CVE O
IDs O
seem O
needed O
( O

response O

, O
open O

) O

, O
Moritz O

they O
appear O
to O
be O
new O
( O

last O
batch O
I O
did O
is O

in O

from O
Jenkins O
) O
. O

This O
can O
be O
therefore O
used O
as O
a O
basis O
for O
phishing O
. O

From O
: O
The O
first O
vulnerability O
is O
commonly O
known O
as O
HTTP O
response O
splitting O
vulnerability O
, O
which O
can O
act O
as O
a O

. O

This O
allows O
an O
anonymous O
attacker O
to O
inject O
malicious O
HTMLs O
to O
pages O
served O
by O
Jenkins O
. O

This O
in O

allows O
an O
attacker O
to O
escalate O
his O
privileges O
by O
hijacking O
sessions O
of O
other O
users O
. O

Please O
use O
CVE-2012-6074 O
for O
this O
issue O
. O

To O
mount O
this O
attack O
, O
the O
attacker O
needs O
to O
know O
the O
exact O
URL O
of O
your O
Jenkins O
installation O
. O

This O
vulnerability O
affects O
those O
who O
run O
Jenkins O
on O
its O
built-in O
servlet O
container O
( O
this O
includes O
all O
the O
native O
packages O
. O
) O

The O
third O
vulnerability O
is O
a O
cross-site O
scripting O
vulnerability O
that O
allows O
an O
attacker O
with O
some O
degree O
of O
write O
access O
in O
Jenkins O
to O
embed O
malicious O
JavaScript O
into O
pages O
generated O
by O
Jenkins O
. O

) O

BEGIN O
PGP O
SIGNED O
MESSAGE O
CA20110426-01 O
: O
Security O
Notice O
for O
CA O
Arcot O
WebFort O
Versatile O
Authentication O
Server O
Issued O
: O
April O
26 O
, O
2011 O
CA O
Technologies O
support O
is O
alerting O
customers O
to O
multiple O
security O
risks O
with O
CA O
Arcot O
WebFort O
Versatile O
Authentication O
Server O
. O

Customers O
can O
contact O
support O
( O
at O
) O
arcot O
( O
dot O
) O
com O
[ O
email O
concealed O
] O
for O
additional O
support O
. O

Workaround O
To O
reduce O
exposure O
, O
administrators O
should O
access O
the O
Administrative O
Console O
by O
bookmark O
and O
not O
follow O
any O
links O
or O
view O
any O
other O
websites O
prior O
to O
visiting O
the O
console O
. O

The O
first O
set O
of O
vulnerabilities O
, O
CVE-2011-1825 O
, O
occur O
due O
to O
insufficient O
handling O
of O
request O
parameters O
sent O
to O
the O
Arcot O
Administrative O
Console O
. O

Affected O
Products O
CA SN
Arcot SN
WebFort SN
Versatile SN
Authentication SN
Server SN
( O
VAS SN
) O
prior SV
to SV
6.2.5 SV
Non-Affected O
Products O
CA O
Arcot O
WebFort O
Versatile O
Authentication O
Server O
( O
VAS O
) O
6.2.5 O
How O
to O
determine O
if O
the O
installation O
is O
affected O
Check O
the O
CA O
Arcot O
WebFort O
Versatile O
Authentication O
Server O
log O
file O
to O
determine O
the O
installed O
release O
version O
. O

An O
attacker O
, O
who O
can O
convince O
a O
user O
to O
follow O
a O
URL O
or O
view O
a O
webpage O
, O
can O
potentially O
conduct O
cross-site O
scripting O
attacks O
. O

Two O
vulnerabilities O
exist O
that O
can O
allow O
a O
remote O
attacker O
to O
potentially O
compromise O
web O
user O
security O
. O

1 O
) O
Using O
Windows O
Explorer O
, O
navigate O
to O
the O
following O
directory O
% O
ARCOT_HOME O
% O
logs O
2 O
) O
Open O
the O
file O
arcotwebfortstartup.log O
and O
search O
for O
the O
below O
string O
to O
find O
the O
version O
. O

STARTING SN
Arcot SN
WebFort SN
Installations O
with O
a O
version O
prior SV
to SV
6.2.5 SV
are O
affected O
. O

Risk O
Rating O
Medium O
Platform O
Windows O
Solaris O
Red O
Hat O
Enterprise O
Linux O

An O
attacker O
, O
who O
can O
convince O
a O
user O
to O
follow O
a O
URL O
or O
view O
a O
webpage O
, O
can O
use O
redirection O
to O
potentially O
carry O
out O
additional O
web O
based O
attacks O
. O

Note O
: O
These O
vulnerabilities O
only O
affect O
the O
Administrative O
Console O
and O
do O
not O
apply O
to O
end O
user O
facing O
pages O
. O

The O
second O
vulnerability O
, O
CVE-2011-1826 O
, O
occurs O
due O
to O
insufficient O
filtering O
of O
a O
request O
parameter O
sent O
to O
the O
Arcot O
Administrative O
Console O
. O

( O
url O
line O
wraps O
) O

Vendor O
Notification O
: O
13 O

Vulnerability O
Type O
: O
XSS O
( O
Cross O
Site O
Scripting O
) O
Status O
: O
Not O

An O
attacker O
can O
use O
browser O
to O

this O
vulnerability O
. O

The O
vulnerability O
exists O
due O
to O

script O
to O

in O

, O

, O

and O

variables O
. O

Successful O

of O
this O
vulnerability O
could O
result O
in O
a O
compromise O
of O
the O
application O
, O
theft O
of O
cookie-based O
authentication O
credentials O
, O
disclosure O
or O
modification O
of O
sensitive O
data O
. O

: O

and SV
probably SV
prior SV
versions O

Introduction O
: O
WebStudio O
CMS O
is O
a O
web-based O
CMS O
system O
Google O
Dork O
: O
Powered O
by O
WebStudio O

Filter O
malicious O
characters O
and O
character O
sequences O
via O
a O
HTTP O
proxy O
or O
firewall O
with O
URL O
filtering O
capabilities O
. O

This O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
script O
code O
in O
the O
security O
context O
of O
an O
affected O
website O
, O
as O
a O
result O
the O
code O
will O
be O

to O
access O
any O
of O
the O
target O
user O
cookies O
, O
access O
data O
recently O
submitted O
by O
the O
target O
user O
via O
web O
form O
to O
the O
site O
, O
or O
take O
actions O
on O
the O
site O
acting O
as O
the O
target O
user O
. O

Description O
: O
User-supplied O
input O
passed O
via O
the O
URL O
is O
not O
properly O
sanitised O
before O
it O
is O
being O
returned O
to O
the O
user O
in O
index.php O
pageid= O
. O

in O

in O
WordPress SN
before SV
2.0.6 SV
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
inject O
arbitrary O
web O
script O
or O
HTML O
via O
a O
CSRF O
attack O
with O
an O
invalid O
token O
and O
quote O
characters O
or O
HTML O
tags O
in O
URL O
variable O
names O
, O
which O
are O
not O
properly O
handled O
when O
WordPress O
generates O
a O
new O
link O
to O
verify O
the O
request O
. O

While O
testing O
WordPress O
it O
was O
discovered O
that O
there O
is O
a O
XSS O
vulnerability O
in O
the O
CSRF O
protection O
of O
WordPress O
administration O
interface O
. O

It O
is O
a O
mature O
and O
stable O
product O
. O

All O
rights O
reserved O
. O

Details O
: O
The O
administration O
interface O
within O
WordPress O
comes O
with O
a O
token O
based O
CSRF O
protection O
. O

2007 O
- O
Public O
Disclosure O
Recommendation O
: O

Depending O
on O

on O
the O
server O
( O
for O

or O

can O
also O
be O
exploited O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
PHP O
code O
. O

We O
hope O
by O

on O
user O

and O
web O
standards O

can O
create O
a O
tool O
different O

against O

. O

might O

in O
a O

of O
the O
admin O
account O
and O
might O
result O
in O
the O
execution O
of O
arbitrary O
PHP O
code O
. O

: O

strongly O

to O

2.0.6 O
which O
also O
fixes O
several O
other O

not O

by O
this O
advisory O
. O

is O
received O
with O
an O
invalid O
token O

is O

discarded O
like O

is O

that O

to O
verify O
the O
action O
by O
clicking O
on O
a O
link O
( O
that O
contains O
a O
valid O
token O
) O
. O

Han O

versions O

issue O

a2 O

does O
not O

. O

A O

of O
concept O

has O

which O

attack O

attack O

) O

0.8.7g SV
[ O

code O
via O
a O
large O

of O

. O

The O

that O
it O
does O
it O
without O
controlling O
the O

of O
this O
array O
. O

Conclusion O
: O
The O
MuPDF O
library O
is O
vulnerable O
to O
a O
stack O
overflow O
and O
could O
be O
exploited O
in O
this O
case O
because O
of O
two O
conditions O
: O
1 O
) O
the O

is O

and O

2 O
) O
it O
was O
compiled O
with O
/GS O
, O
maybe O
with O
an O
old O
version O
of O

which O
doesn O
t O
protect O
arrays O
of O
floats O
with O
stack O
cookies O
. O

Analysis O
: O
When O

. O

2 O
) O

that O

Home O
: O

: O
of O
Concept O
: O
: O
This O
vulnerability O
leads O
to O
a O
remote O
code O
execution O
when O
a O
user O
opens O
a O
malicious O

document O
. O

The O
size O
of O
the O
temporary O
buffer O
is O
limited O
to O
0x400 O
bytes O
as O
can O
be O
seen O
in O
fz_strlcpy O
( O
... O
) O
. O

If O
some O
conditions O
are O
fulfilled O
, O
we O
can O
trigger O
a O
stack O
overflow O
in O
the O
xps_parse_color O
( O
) O
function O
when O
it O
parses O
the O
value O
ContextColor O
of O
the O
attribute O
Fill O
. O

As O
said O
above O
, O
we O
have O
to O
make O
our O
payload O
fit O
into O
an O
array O
of O
floats O
. O

The O
reason O
is O
that O
the O
stack O
concerns O
a O
float O
array O
and O
an O
old O
version O
of O
Visual O
Studio O
doesn O
t O
add O
security O
cookies O
in O
this O
case O
. O

Here O
is O
an O
example O
: O
< O
FixedPage O

793.76 O

1122.56 O
xmlns= O
xml O
: O

und O
< O

7.738695572473460e+033,7.738695572473460e+033,7.813604562190658e+033,7.188661121986312e-043,7.861639730565029e+033,8.968310171678829e-044 O
and O
so O
on O
. O

Software O
: O
MuPDF O
v1.3 O

We O
can O
t O
erase O
the O
SEH O
because O
of O
the O
small O
stack O
buffer O
but O
depending O
on O
the O
concerned O
software O
, O
it O
maybe O
possible O
to O
replace O
interesting O
variables O
or O
structures O
values O
to O
control O
the O
EIP O
. O

For O
this O
reason O
it O
important O
that O
each O
float O
has O
a O
long O
ansi O
size O
( O
about O
22 O
bytes O
) O
, O
otherwise O
it O
could O
be O
not O
precise O
enough O
to O
get O
the O
real O

values O
. O

So O
, O
1024 O
22 O
= O
46 O
4 O
bytes O
= O
184 O
bytes O
( O
not O
enough O
to O
put O
our O
shellcode O
) O
. O

I O
used O
the O
font O
attribute O
to O
allocate O
binary O
data O
, O
controlling O
the O
size O
for O
each O
of O
them O
else O
it O
not O
possible O
to O
make O
precise O
allocations O
. O

ASLR O
can O
be O
bypassed O
in O
this O
case O
because O
mupdf.exe O
isn O
t O
ASLR O
compiled O
. O

Practically O
, O
we O
need O
to O
generate O
many O
font O
files O
containing O
our O
binary O
data O
into O
a O
folder O
and O
write O
the O
path O
of O
each O
of O
them O
into O
the O
page O
file O
using O
FontUri O
attribute O
of O
Glyphs O
like O
shown O
below O
to O
load O
them O
. O

ebx O
contains O
the O
size O
of O
our O
block O
( O
0x100000 O
) O
. O

< O
/FixedPage O
3 O
) O

In O
this O
case O
, O
it O
appears O
that O
only O
VirtualAlloc O
is O
necessary O
to O
bypass O
DEP O
. O

Buffer O
overflow O
in O
the O
xfs_readlink O
function O
in O
fs/xfs/xfs_vnodeops.c O
in O
XFS O
in O
the O
Linux SN
kernel SN
2.6 SV
, O
when O
CONFIG_XFS_DEBUG O
is O
disabled O
, O
allows O
local O
users O
to O
cause O
a O
denial O
of O
service O
( O
memory O
corruption O
and O
crash O
) O
and O
possibly O
execute O
arbitrary O
code O
via O
an O
XFS O
image O
containing O
a O
symbolic O
link O
with O
a O
long O
pathname O
. O

Proposed O
upstream O
patch O
: O
References O
: O
Thanks O
, O
Petr O
Matousek O
Red O
Hat O
Security O
Response O
Team O

: O

configuration O
option O
was O
not O
enabled O
when O
compiling O
Linux O
kernel O
, O
an O
attacker O

to O

image O
could O
use O
this O
flaw O
to O
crash O
the O
system O
, O
or O

, O

his O
privileges O
on O
that O
system O
. O

SQL O
injection O
vulnerability O
in O
ATCOM SN
Netvolution SN
2.5.8 SV
ASP O
allows O
remote O
attackers O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
SQL O
commands O
via O
the O
Referer O
HTTP O
header O
. O

We O
have O
repeatedly O
contacted O
the O
software O
vendor O
about O
this O
issue O
but O
we O
have O
not O
received O
a O
reply O
. O

It O
appears O
that O
the O
Netvolution O
platform O
has O
both O
ASP O
and O
PHP O
implementations O
. O

Netvolution O
is O
a O
commercial O
content O
management O
system O
by O
ATCOM O
S.A. O
with O
a O
large O
number O
of O
installations O
, O
most O
of O
them O
belonging O
to O
Greek O
companies O
and O
organizations O
. O

An O
attacker O
may O
inject O
arbitrary O
SQL O
commands O
to O
the O
Netvolution O
database O
by O
using O
a O
xc3 O
xa2 O

A O
malicious O
user O
may O
utilize O
this O
vulnerability O
to O
modify O
content O
on O
the O
vulnerable O
website O
, O
inject O
malicious O
javascript O
code O
to O
a O
visitor O
xc3 O
xa2 O

The O
bug O
is O
located O
in O
the O
code O
that O
parses O
the O
xc3 O
xa2 O

HTTP O
Referer O
xc3 O
xa2 O

Vendor O
Contact O
( O
s O
) O
: O
August O
31st O
, O
2011 O
September O
1st O
, O

discovered O

This O
advisory O
concerns O
a O
bug O
found O
in O
the O
ASP SN
implementation SN
( O
version O
2.5.8 SV
) O
. O

We O
were O
unable O
to O
verify O
with O
the O
vendor O
if O
this O
bug O
also O
affects O
other O
versions O
of O
the O
ASP O
( O
or O
PHP O
) O
codebase O
. O

xc2 O
x9d O
header O
. O

More O
information O
about O
this O
vulnerability O
and O
a O
Proof O
of O
Concept O
are O
available O
here O
. O

As O
header O
field O
values O
are O
normally O
not O
included O
in O
HTTP O
transaction O
logs O
, O
an O
attack O
based O
on O
this O
vulnerability O
may O
go O
unnoticed O
by O
web O
server O
administrators O
. O

Administrators O
of O
Netvolution O
websites O
are O
advised O
to O
check O
with O
the O
software O
vendor O
to O
ensure O
that O
they O
are O
running O
a O
non-vulnerable O
version O
of O
the O
CMS O
. O

and O

( O
CVE O
) O
project O
has O
assigned O
the O

to O
this O

. O

blind O
xc3 O

flaw O
exists O
in O

( O

) O
. O

Vendors O
: O
Symantec O

providing O

specific O
request O
an O
attacker O
can O
bypass O
the O

and O

: O

process O
fails O
to O
properly O
validate O

to O
port O

. O

Vulnerability O

function O
in O
StoneTrip SN

( O
aka SN

Vulnerability O
Description O
Ston3D O
is O
a O
cross-platform O
technology O
developed O
by O
StoneTrip O
, O
allowing O
applications O
developed O
with O
ShiVa O
product O
to O
be O
run O
from O
various O
media O
. O

Vendor O
Information O
, O

and O

The O
vendor O
did O
not O
provide O
this O
information O
. O

This O
technology O
provides O
a O
scripting O
interface O
based O
on O
the O
Lua O
programming O
language O
, O
within O
this O
interface O
the O
function O
ystem.openURL O
is O
defined O
as O
follows O
: O
Prototype O
system.openURL O
( O
sURL O
, O
sTarget O
) O
Call O
this O
function O
to O
open O
an O
URL O
. O

1 O

2009-04-23 O
: O
Technical O
details O
sent O
to O
StoneTrip O
team O
by O
Core O
. O

It O
provides O
the O
function O
ystem.openURL O
( O
) O
which O
does O
not O
properly O
sanitize O
the O
input O
before O
using O
it O
. O

A O
possible O
mitigation O
action O
would O
be O
to O
enable O
MIME O
type O
filtering O
in O
your O
IDS/proxies O
and O
block O
S3DPlayer O
traffic O
: O
application/x-ston3d-stk O
- O
As O
a O
workaround O
, O
vulnerable O
users O
can O
also O
avoid O
this O
flaw O
by O
disabling O
the O
Ston3D O
Plugin O
in O
their O
web O
browsers O
: O
6.1 O
. O

on O
the O
Manage O

... O
4 O
. O

We O

computer O

system O

, O

, O

to O

. O

, O

. O

. O

Ston3D O
StandalonePlayer O
, O
2. O
and O
Ston3D O
WebPlayer O
, O
which O
runs O
like O
an O
extension O
or O
plug-in O
within O
most O
popular O
web O
browsers O
. O

2009-05-18 O
: O
Core O
Advisories O
Team O
does O
not O
release O
the O
advisory O
as O
originally O
planned O
. O

Technical O
Description O
Proof O
of O
Concept O
Code O
Ston3D O
is O
a O
cross-platform O
technology O
allowing O
applications O
developed O
with O
ShiVa O
product O
to O
be O
run O
from O
various O
media O
, O
such O
as O
a O
website O
, O
CD/DVD O
or O
interactive O
equipment O
. O

This O
can O
be O
exploited O
to O
execute O
arbitrary O
commands O
with O
the O
privileges O
of O
the O
Stone3D O
player O
by O
opening O
a O
specially O
crafted O
file O
. O

2009-05-28 O
: O

trying O
to O
contact O
the O

team O
several O
times O
without O
success O
, O
the O
advisory O

is O
published O
as O
User O

. O

in O

in O

in O

SP4 SV

Technical O
Details O
The O

script O
is O
the O
responsible O
for O
vulnerability O

it O

attack O

: O

system O

to O

of O

: O

xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx/app_license.shtml O
app=ORWELLLABS O
% O
3Bcat O
% O
20/etc/passwd O

data O
entered O
in O
parameter O
app O
= O
is O
passed O
without O
any O
treatment O
for O
devtools.sh O
script O
located O
at O
: O
{ O
HTMLROOL O
} O
/bin/devtools.sh O
This O
script O
contains O
several O
functions O
, O
namely O
: O
list O
( O
) O
status O
( O
) O
menulist O
( O
) O

( O
) O

( O
) O

( O
) O

interact O
with O
the O
parameters O
passed O
by O
the O
web O
application O
through O
the O
affected O
scripts O
( O
e.g O
. O

All O
